review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great staff. Shuttle service was great from the airport, but limited in the evening to San Francisco. There isn't any shopping (groceries) in the area. Limited restaruants. Taxi rides were expensive. Breakfast was Excellant, Evening reception was very good. Quiet hotel, with Very large rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was doing painting outside, which was a little incovenient. Furniture in room was dated and needed replaced. Carpet was very worn. Breakfast was good. Set up was disorganized. Stayed at many of their hotels, others were better organized. Overall good hotel.

review.title: Stole my jacket and prescription sunglasses
review.reviewText: Checked out at 4am.  Went straight to airport.  While in shuttle, remembered that i left my jacket in ny room.  I immediately called the hotel.  Housekeeping was not in yet.  When i called back, they said they didn't find my jacket.  Without a doubt it was left in the room.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Very good stay, everyone friendly and helpful. And Melanie at the Front Desk immediately helped me to relax after long drive.
Everything was beautiful except the complimentary breakfast buffet. How do you serve unfresh potatoes O'Brian and hard pancakes? I did appreciate the sanctuary feel of the room.
Very nice facility and rooms but the cost of internet, parking and room tax is more than I would pay for a decent room in most towns.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for internet connection and parking.

review.title: Thank you
review.reviewText:
Everything was good so far
I'll stay again next time. And tell my friends about it.
Thank you

review.title: Hotel needs a major renovation
review.reviewText:
Bathrooms are very old and outdated 
Breakfast hours are not convenient , it ends at 9 am
Compared with other embassy hotels this is the worst
Sofa bed broken, breakfast was bad, too many people

review.title: near the airport and near san Francisco state
review.reviewText: The hotel location is very convenient and the room layout works well for our family travel arrangements
review.positiveRemarks: two rooms and breakfast included
review.negativeRemarks: free wifi
review.locationRemarks: near the freeway

review.title: Middle of road trip
review.reviewText: My family of five was in the middle of a road trip through CA.  We stayed at Embassy Suites for three nights.  At first we were disappointed when we realized we were a ways from San Francisco, but then it ended up working out perfect.  The drive into SF and back to the hotel was no big deal.  My kids were so overwhelmed with SF, it felt nice to drive out of the craziness and back to the calm, serene hotel after a full day in the heart of the city!  We were very pleased with every aspect of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a perfect escape from crazy SF after spending each day as a touristing family in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: The room service menu items should be explained on the menu.  An basic explanation of each item and what is included...we had allergies to deal with.
review.locationRemarks: There isn't anything to do too close by, but we ended up liking the distance from the city after all.  At first I thought I made a major mistake.

review.title: Breackfast
review.reviewText: I really really liked the bresckfast, excellent way to begin the morning, thank you

review.title: Ok Hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff. Buffet breakfasts made it easy to plan the day. Very accommodating staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, shuttle bus availability and lots of space. Buffet breakfasts included.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom/shower faucet was leaking.
review.locationRemarks: Good.

review.reviewText: Hotel very close to airport and light rail. Not that many restaurants close by. Overall, good hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel, beyond my expectations
review.reviewText: The rooms were amazing! Very spacious with living room & dining table. Staffs are accommodating & had excellent food in their breakfast buffet!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Nice size rooms with a nice happy hour. Location was good and had no issues getting the shuttle in the morning for the airport.

The hotel is beautiful! such nice staff! the pool gets crowded by kids but by 10pm its empty for the adults, it closes at midnight which was greatly appreciated! the free breakfast was delicious! a lot of variety!
The hotel exceeded our expectations. Convenient access to the city.

review.title: Totally disappointing
review.reviewText: My family stayed here recently. We had tickets to a Giants game and chose this hotel based on proximity to a Caltrain station. We arrived at 3pm to check in and were told to come back in 45 minutes because our room was not ready. We had to catch the train at 4:19 in order to make it to the game so we had to change and get ready in the lobby restrooms. Since our room was still not ready by 4pm we had to store our luggage back in our car. After the game at around 11pm we were able to get our room. The moment we walked in our sense of smell was assaulted. my 8 year old asked if the scented the room with smelly armpits. I would say it was more of a cross between wet birthplace and damp moldy carpet. That wasn't even the best part. The carpet was actually damp throughout the room!  When we finally settled down to sleep in the mattresses from a 1978 RV, we couldn't sleep because there was a party with bumping music directly below us. When I called the front desk, they said "sorry about that, we could try asking if they can settle down a bit"   I will never stay there again. This is what the low low price of $300 will get you if you stay there (sarcastically said).
review.positiveRemarks: nothing
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything!
review.locationRemarks: The captain station is just right down the road

review.title: Suite
review.reviewText:
Booked for a suite, but then there was actually no difference comparing just the regular rooms.  
It was just on the very top floor.

review.title: Nice hotel to stay and dine
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed fully. Morning breakfast and evening drinks are awesome.

review.title: Needs a renovation.
review.reviewText: Rooms were dark and dated.  Don't sleep on the pullout couch - cheap spring mattress will make you regret it.  While we were there the elevator failed so we had to walk up and down the stairs - tough after a day of romping up and down the streets of San Francisco.  Management kept waking up our kids with their announcements on their PA system to advise everybody when the elevator would be fixed at entirely too late at night (inappropriate and pointless that late).  They didn't charge for parking - easy to see why because they have an obvious bird problem - if you park your vehicle in the lot outside on the west, expect your car to be completely plastered with bird feces daily.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast.  Staff was friendly.  Pool was okay.
review.negativeRemarks: Brighten it up in the rooms - get rid of cheap mattresses - fix bird problems.

review.title: Clean and Comfy
review.reviewText: When we visit the Bay Area we always look for hotels outside the city (better rates) and if you don't mind a 10-15 minute drive then this is the place for you. You could find cheaper hotels but this was worth it for us, and the sofa bed? It was GREAT!! My 9 yo and 3 yo took over it and we all slept comfortably. We will definitely go back and book this hotel for future visits. The pictures on the website ARE accurate for once!!!!

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was excellent. It is time for the rooms to get an update. Why do the beds have to be so hard
Overall a very good experience
Loved this hotel my family and I had a great time.
It was good for a family of five breakfast was continental and was as good as any restaurant

review.title: Nice but could be better
review.reviewText: Hotel is in serious need of update. Some plane noise. Construction noise in adjoining rooms.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: The bathroom is tired but overall fine experience. Interne worked. Food at happy hour was a bit greasy. Well really greasy offerings. The veggies were just...there. The chips a bit..greasy. Food at happy hour could be more inspiring.

Complimentary breakfast is bad (and made to order omlet was excluded).  

Room stank of overpowering scent, the furniture was old, seemed dusty and just generally not comfortable.  

The windows of the room was also not very well isolated, so it was super noisy from the airport, freeway and the train system.  That, and the first night, I heard a bunch of people screaming in the atrium so it was good that the room was a suite and the bedroom was not facing the hallway/atrium.  

Car parking was supposedly not included and was told a ridiculous amount, even though I saw many people just coming in and out from an open gate in the back.  Seeing that this is an airport hotel in the middle of nowhere, and enough parking spots around the back, they should just open it up to all guests of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: redo the rooms so it doesn't look and smell super old

review.title: Nice Hotel for Conference
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for a conference over the weekend. The room was a comfortable place to be with all the things in it that I would expect and more.  It would be nice to have a little better coffee in the morning, but the lids made it easier for me to take it and run, which was a nice touch seeing as I needed to get out very earlier in the morning.  While a bit pricey, I got what I paid for. I was able to enjoy their great breakfast the second day. Overall, quite please.
review.positiveRemarks: The two roomed suite, bed comfortable, clos to where I needed to be and the breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Better coffee in room.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't have time to enojoy

review.title: So convenient
review.reviewText:
Free full breakfast 
Free airport shuttle 
Free shuttles to different restaurant/shopping and attractions on different days
Free afternoon snack/cocktail hour
It was a lovely stay! Clean, relaxing, and nice getaway for me.

review.title: Okay hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel overall was okay but the carpets really needs to be changed soon, it was worn out already.
We stayed there because we needed a hotel close to the airport on our way home to Canada. The location was good, the breakfast was good, the room aside from the worn out  carpet and clogged wet bar was okay.
The staff at Front Desk was not committed to any customer service of any level. The person who checked us in was checking me in and at the same time picking up two customer calls which in turn he had to address, leaving me to wait to be checked-in and when he did, he just told me I'm good to go forgetting to give me my room keys. He apologized for the slight oversight. but he did not even confirm what type of room I'm getting and at what rate.
That evening after we came back, I went to the desk again to ask about the parking facilities, but the phone was ringing off the hook so I waited on the side where I witnessed the Hotel Manager answer another guest without any care who was there or if anybody was listening with such haughty attitude and total disrespect. He was not even listening to what the guest was saying, he just dismissed the guest and that was it. I left without asking my question thinking it didn't matter anymore after what I just witnessed. The Hotel Managers (mature Causcasian man) attitude does not belong to a hotel chain like this.

review.title: Beautiful room!
review.reviewText: The room was great but the A/C did not function the first day we were there, and had to request help with it multiple times. It was finally fixed the second afternoon. Other than that it was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast, the size of rooms, the atmosphere, the afternoon reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Just to be sure everything is working properly.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco, it has it all, great food, scenery, best wine on the planet!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Staff were really nice and helpful. Breakfast was delicious.

review.title: Family reunion
review.reviewText: We had a good time.  Our rooms were specious, with nice view.  We might gather together in dining  room and enjoy beautiful panorama while were eating and talking.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice large rooms, cozy beds/mattresses.  Good  breakfast.  Nice looking hotel facility inside.  Beautiful view from windows.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking.  Too crowded in swimming pool.  There was specific smell in our rooms. Cleaning supplies?

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: This is not our first time in this Hotel, we've actually stayed at same hotel but different location ...This place is awesome...Stayed at their suites and I highly recommend it to everybody. Clean and took are spacious...

review.title: Gorgeous atrium and breakfast area
review.reviewText:
We checked in late (midnight) and I am fairly certain the front desk clerk was sleeping when we came in.
He didn't say hello, and all in all said very little to me (room number and where to park, what time breakfast was) I didn't expect a lot of chatter, but I expected friendly at least.

We came into our room, which appeared to be great. And it was, the beds were comfy and the rooms were so big and roomy.
The only real problem I found was it appeared to not have been vaccumed well (chips and crumbs all along the dresser cabinet in the bedroom) 
Also, when I took a shower on Saturday night at abot 9-10 pm.
There was great water pressure but zero hot water. It cant even be considered "luke warm" it was cold.

 The free breakfast in the morning is absolutely amazing. The only complaint I have is that on the weekends it doesn't start until 7 AM. And I had a 9 AM flight so I wasn't able to eat before my flight.

 The airport shuttle driver is great and gets you there on time and is very helpful. 

 Like I said all in all the hotel is great it does have room for improvement but the hiccups that I found are not enough to have me not stay there again. But I would actually prefer to stay next door at the lakespur, where I stayed happily previous to this.
But sadly, they were booked up this trip.
Embassy suites is a good second choice for me.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Very nice room and the cook to order omelette in the morning with buffet breakfast was exactly what I needed:)

review.title: Great for Families.
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights went to Giants game, Alcatraz, and Pier 39. Our kids enjoyed the pool, and breakfast. Very kid -family friendly staff they were all so kind. Thank you so much!
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: AT&T Park & Pier 39.

review.reviewText: Professional staff. Clean rooms. Would definitely book again.

review.title: A 2 star at best
review.reviewText: This hotel should be a 2 star at most, very badly run down and is a poor representation of the Hilton brand. Rooms were run down, pull out sofa was very thin and blankets had tears all over.  Room was actually dirty (full trash can, plugged dirty sink, trash on floor) when we arrived to the room.  Called the front desk and let it ring for a solid minute with no answer so I called again and the phone was picked up and put down, no greeting no "hold on" nothing....I listened for almost 2 minutes of the front desk having conversations with guest.  Remote for TV did not work which was the main reason for my call with two children...cartoons are a must.  I finally hung up and walked down to the lobby where I asked for the manager, I showed pics of the room condition and of my front desk experience, he stated that the hotel is an older hotel and will be upgraded next year. He apologized and offered a discount on my night, I informed him that I had booked for 2 nights but I will be finding another hotel because Embassy was a huge disappointment.  Also they have an indoor pool which is the main reason I booked since my kids love to swim but the chlorine smell was terribly strong throughout the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: nothing
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs to be renovated
review.locationRemarks: No nearby restaurants or stores

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice family hotel. I recommend it for family with kids. Stayed 3 nights. Staff are friendly. Food is good. Go to breakfast early. I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Above Average!
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites is a wonderful hotel. We enjoyed our stay. The continental breakfast was excellent. All the staff was pleasant, friendly, and hard working. The only complaint: it can be loud at certain times, but still worthy of an excellent rating.

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: The staff was rude, and they gave our reserved room away

review.title: Hidden taxes
review.reviewText: Like the title says Hidden taxes. They tax on everything. What started as a bargain turned into a headache. DO NOT come to this embassy

review.title: nice hotel near SFO and not that far from the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable.  A good Embassy.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice but the beds are not at all comfortable for the star rating it has.

review.title: Don't stay on the weekends.
review.reviewText: Stayed Thursday - Monday. Weekday business class guest are the best. Weekend guests were noisy, yelling and running in hallways. There was yelling and fights in the parking lot which caused many car alarms to sound during the night .This happened twice on Saturday am and once on Sunday am. Guests smoking on the available public balcony's and the smoke could be smelled from within our room. Very noisy on the weekend with guests who obviously don't stay in hotels very often.
review.positiveRemarks: All of the staff was friendly and accommodating to any request we made. Breakfast and reception staff were very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: If you are going to lower your weekend price to bring in more guests, hire more security to monitor the inside and outside activities.

review.title: Embassy needs updating
review.reviewText:
This is one of the oldest Embassy Suites that has not been updated.
Carpet is 70's orange/brown and so is the sofa that looked like it belonged in a flea market.

Very disappointed.  I fly to SF frequently and this is one of the worst hotels I have stayed at.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very good
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating

review.title: Superbowl 50
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service!  Loved the buffet breakfast and happy hour specials.  Beds were very comfy and rooms were well kept!
review.positiveRemarks: Everyone took care of us.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location-close to airport, transportation to downtown was great,etc.

review.title: Good location if flying out of SFO.
review.reviewText: Beds and pillows comfortable. Happy hour not so great but breakfast was excellent. Paper thin walls. Heat issues.
review.positiveRemarks: Large rooms. Free shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms outdated.

review.reviewText: The breakfast buffet was great and the reception in the afternoon too.

review.title: Overall, great stay
review.reviewText: I started my stay off disappointed. Our flight was due into San Francisco around 8:30 PM, but the flight was delayed and we got in a few minutes after midnight. At the airport we called for the free shuttle that had been advertised for this hotel...and were told that the shuttle only runs UNTIL midnight. We had to get a taxi...not a great beginning. That being said, it was pretty smooth sailing from there. We got a room upgrade (with free WiFi), which made the whole family happy. The pool was great, the complimentary breakfasts were FAR beyond what we expected - EXCELLENT! Very healthy, many choices, great cooking...a definite selling point for the hotel. The free shuttle into town on Friday and Saturday was awesome, as well - a great program! Aside from the airport shuttle hiccup in the beginning, the only other shadow on my report card falls over the hotel restaurant. We ate there Saturday night. It was ok - the food was fine but service was a bit slow. We went back Sunday night, and our meal  was so delayed (over an hour!) that our meal was comp'ed. That being said...they comp'ed our meal, so my complaint is rather half-hearted. :)
review.positiveRemarks: Just about everything
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant dinner service, round-the-clock airport shuttle availability (or clearly stated limitations on airport shuttle hours in the advertising).

review.reviewText: It's fantastic accommodation for a family.  Good facilities, family could stay in the hotel to be entairtanted for a whole day.  No public transport, you will need a car!

Overall the stay was good.  The first night was not great, due to a next door resident making a lot of noise until about 4 am.  I called the front desk twice and after the second complaint, around 3:30 am, they got quite. 

On day two, we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant and the service was terrible. After we were seated, the server did not take our drink order until about 30 minutes after.  Twenty minutes had passed and our food order was taken (at this point our drinks were still not ready).  Another 10 minutes passed, nothing was served and we became very frustrated.  I went to management and complained. The manager had to step in and start taking orders and serving the food.  It was ridiculous.  After we got our food, one of our entrees did not smell right.  After taking a bit we discovered that cheese was bad.  We complained and they luckily removed that expense from our bill.

review.title: Nice hotel and comfortable but..
review.reviewText: Nice room, comfortable bed, clean and nice staffs. Everything went very well but the next day, in the morning, I ate the breakfast there. It actually really good breakfast but suddenly after I ate, I feel something wrong in my tummy. I mean right away after I ate breakfast. I just ignored it because maybe its too early for me to eat breakfast and we just check out then After that I got stomach upset and diarrhea. I'm not sure where did I get that. the only thing that I'm sure was after I ate breakfast over there.

review.title: Very Nice and clean.
review.reviewText: It was nice my family saved up so we could take my husband to a SF Giants game.  It was a real treat.
review.negativeRemarks: Night desk staff might be kinder to the lower class but the room and day staff made up for it.

review.title: Great hotel near SFO and public transit
review.reviewText: Everything is great at this hotel.  Will come back again.

review.title: Nice hotel for extended stay.
review.reviewText: Free breakfast and accommodating staff was very nice. Free internet awesome! Daily evening free snacks cool.

review.title: How did this get 3.5 stars??
review.reviewText: This was a 2-star experience (at best). The shower was dirty and the water temperature fluctuated between scalding hot and freezing cold. The beds weren't comfortable (but linens appeared clean).  There was a police incident in the lobby that brought multiple police cruisers to the hotel in the early morning hours of our stay.  The hotel supervisor was at the front desk when we checked out and I informed him of my dissatisfaction at our stay, to which I received a shoulder shrug and an uninterested grunt.  The girl with the blue hair that checked us in was more professional than the supervisor!  The free breakfast was the only high-point, which isn't saying much....

review.title: Excellent free breakfast and evening happy hour
review.reviewText:
Hotel located near the San Francisco Airport and I went this hotel with my family, included Breakfast and evening happy hour is very convenience for us. Hotel room is very large size (1 bed room and 1 dining room) and have a microwave.
Hotel staff is very kind and fast check-in and check-out. But I should pay for parking fee $22 (with tax).
Overall Hotel is good and family type kind hotel.

review.title: Convenient close to the City and SFO airport.
review.reviewText: Roomy was hot, light bulbs were out, breakfast was crowded.

review.title: Awesome experience!!!
review.reviewText: from the time we ckecked in til we got in the room! kids were hungry! there were snacks and cold drinks prepared!!! wow!! the kids cleaned up the snacks real quick, no more than ten mins housekeeping came and replenished our snacks and drinks!! I love the Embassy Suites!! Rooms are clean and breakfast was fantastic!! We are definately staying here for new years eve!!! Two thumbs up and woot woot for Embassy Suites for making my family feel special even if it was for one night!! Great job to all employees who always greeted us with a smile!!!

review.title: nice hotel, kid friendly, 20 minutes from the city
review.reviewText: This hotel was well worth every penny.  All the staff was very nice and the "cooked to order" breakfast for free the next morning was a added bonus.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel! Only down side is you have to pay $22 per day for parking! Other than that they serve breakfast you get comp drinks! Rooms are excellent
Beautiful hotel. Clean, warm and inviting. Breakfast was awesome. Location, perfect...away from hustle of downtown.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Had two rooms, one king bed and one double double. First night there was given two King bed rooms due to the hotel being full and getting bumped from our double double room. Was given a double double room the next night. A little frustrating.
review.positiveRemarks: Great breakfast buffet, nice evening reception, good staff.

review.title: not overly impressed
review.reviewText: First pickup on shuttle to airport which goes ton5 other hoteks and adds extra 20 mins to journey. Found that annoying. Beds are fulls not queens. Small for two people. That is my main complaint. Family of five felt packed into the suite because beds are too small.

review.title: Amazing Hotel, Not so great Staff.
review.reviewText: The hotel is pretty well clean and maintained but the front desk staff was rude and made us wait about 30 mins before getting our room. They were also rude and not very helpful, the staff from the bar and restaurant were a thousand times better then their front desk cashiers.

review.title: Near SFO with shuttle services
review.reviewText: The hotel building is nice and the room very spacious. However we stayed thanksgiving day and they changed their food service without telling the front desk I assume. We were told the restaurant had a turkey special and the restaurant was open till 10 pm. We went down for dinner at 7:30 and they said they ran out of turkey and would be closing early. Then we were told breakfast started at 6 am, which worked perfect for us since we had an early flight. We went downstairs at 6 and were told the management decided to Change breakfast to 7:30 because it was the morning after thanksgiving. Needless to say we struck out with food twice. Then when we got on the airport shuttle we were told they had to make 4 additional stops at oher hotels before dropping us at the airport. It was a good thing we were early. In the end I would not stay here again.

review.title: Excellent stay for groups!
review.reviewText: I had several rooms booked for family event in the area! We were all able to be closely booked next to each other and have FREE breakfast together (which is EXCELLENT!) and also wind down in the evening with HAPPY HOUR! Another FREE amenity! Overall, excellent choice for a hotel stay, if you're in the area!
review.positiveRemarks: FREE breakfast, FREE Happy Hour and overall ambiance for the hotel and customer-friendly staff, make this a TOP choice of mine!

review.title: Clean, and close.
review.reviewText: Check in was fast, the lobby was super clean and very open. The staff was nice and our room was clean. Made to order omelettes and hot breakfast items were very nice. (I think the cooks should have a tip cup). The courtesy hour was great, even though I dont drink alcohol the snacks were great. Again people dont forget to tip your bartender. Recommend stay for family and dont forget the swimsuit for the indoor pool. Incase you do there is a target just 5 miles away.
Elegant hotel, good amennities, exelent workers, good food

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Excellent quality and service! The suite room we stayed in was huge (and clean)! Beautiful and classy look. Front desk always smiles and makes you feel welcome. Fast check-in and check-out. The complimentary breakfast makes my taste buds tingle just thinking about it again. Parking was good. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely be choosing this place again in the future! :)

review.title: services
review.reviewText: Convenience close to the airport shuttle service great reception was great ,,,,rooms were very nice ,,,,, I would say your staff if trained very well on how to deal w nasty customers,,,, I wish I could remember her name name but she dealt with this guy better then I would have

review.title: Very nice and friendly!
review.reviewText: My daughter booked this trip for me and I have to say once again I am very impressed!
review.positiveRemarks: The close proximity to all the activities
review.locationRemarks: We did Curiodyssey and other child friendly activites!

review.reviewText: Very friendly and accommodating staff. Great complimentary breakfast.

review.title: I really enjoyed the friendly atmosphere.
review.reviewText: The people were friendly and down to earth. The atrium took away any stuffy hotel feeling. The only thing is, I wish they had a sauna. The free breakfast and drinks were fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: all of the above
review.negativeRemarks: sauna
review.locationRemarks: ok, not great. You need a car

review.title: Close to downtown
review.reviewText: I'm overall it's a nice facility but the rooms could use a few upgrades especially the Windows

review.title: Close to an event
review.reviewText: We stayed in 2 bed suite was perfect location for the event we were attending

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: Always have enjoyed embassy suites. Complimentary breakfast and happy hour. Courtesy shuttle is convenient.

review.title: Needs renovation
review.reviewText: The common areas of this hotel were lovely. The room, however, was falling apart. We had lots of space (1 bedroom and a separate living room for family of 5), but the bathroom sink was leaking all over from the faucet, and had apparently been doing so for a while, since there was mold along the wall where the water was pooling. Also, the entire inside of the floor-to-ceiling windows was soaking wet in the morning, and it hasn't even rained. Guess it was from fog? Even so, it was gross. The carpeted area by the window was spongy from water. We were disgusted. We left after only one night instead of staying for two, as we had planned.

review.title: Convenience, complementary breakfast
review.reviewText: We book in our way to the hotel,and 5 minutes later we went in and our room was ready. We had to pay extra for parking but at the moment I saw the lobby and the restaurant and we knew it was worthy. For my surprise when we got to the room it was so nice. clean, and suite style, living room separate of the bedroom, and all amenities needed for a nice stay. Sadly we couldn't enjoy more because we check in friday night, had breakfast early and went to the city, came back saturday night to sleep for our early flight. I wish I could enjoy the pool the my complementary Sunday breakfast. But at least my room was really pleasant and quite. Really close to the airport and close to the city.
review.positiveRemarks: the room and breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Less for parking fee
review.locationRemarks: convenience

review.title: Nice hotel but have to pay for every extras
review.reviewText: People making breakfast were super nice.  Had to have keys redone at least once a day and girls at desk were a little rude/sarcastic.  Rooms were clean.  Didn't like having to pay for parking(not in a garage) and for Internet.
review.positiveRemarks: Room clean.  Breakfast was pretty good and the workers at breakfast were very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco- bridges, beaches,the pier, Giants game

review.title: The hotel is close to the city.
review.reviewText: The price is reasonable. Breakfast was great. The only thing I didn't like was that someone checked into my room under my name which made me feel unsafe & question why they'd allow someone else in my room under my name if it wasn't me.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: We found the room comfortable, the furniture is starting to look a little "tired". Was disappointed the pool was under maintenance the few days we were there but do realize that has to be done from time to time. Having the shuttle into Union Square on the Friday and Saturday was great as we were able to get into San Francisco easily. The Managers Happy Hour, was great, was one of the reasons we elected to stay at the Embassy Suites.
review.positiveRemarks: The relaxed feel with the tropical look in the centre of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets and some furniture will need replacing soon.

review.title: A great Hotel for a weekend with kids.
review.reviewText: I love staying at Embassy Suites! I love the free breakfast, and its a good breakfast, lots of variety. They have great staff and facility. The shuttle to and from the airport was very convenient . The kids loved the pool.

review.title: Good value for the location.
review.reviewText: Everything was great. Staff very helpful, and responsive. Room clean. Breakfast buffet food was good. Only recommendation to hotel is to make signs for foods and place in location of items clearer. I.e. Put coffee, creamer and sugar together. Put butter with bread to be toasted and put oatmeal with cereals. all drinks, juices together, etc. only complaint.
Only complaint was that the pool was closed for construction!!!!

review.title: 2 night stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed here on a trip to California. Spacious, well equipped clean room. Hotel interior nicely decorated. Great breakfast selection. Enjoyed the stay and would recommend it to friends and family.

review.title: They blamed Expedia
review.reviewText: No sleep, no crib for the baby, bed bugs, soap scum in the bathroom. But they blamed Expedia. I went in and paid early for the rooms for my family that were coming in late.  They had 3 children and one was a 1 year old.  I had asked for a crib.  I had also requested that on Expedia.  When they arrived no crib they had to wait 3 hours before the crib arrived at their room.  That was horrible for the family.  No sleep. They woke up to bites on them and the baby. Went to take a shower in the morning and there was soap scum in the shower. NO discount for veterans.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: The service when you ask for something like a crib.  No bed bugs, a clean shower with no soap scum.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel and breakfasts were fine.  However, my reservation that was made for a friend and myself more than two months prior to my stay, was not honored. My reservation was for a suite with two double beds. We were given a room with one king bed and when I asked for a room change, I was told that there were not any other rooms available.  I was also told that the hotel has the right to change room reservations when a reservation was made through a third party provider - i.e. in this case, Expedia.  The staff person at the front desk said that this right was "in the fine print".  Unfortunately, when one's choice of room expectations are changed upon arrival, it creates an upset than should not have happened.  It was very disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: The shuttle service between the hotel and the airport was great as well as the complimentary shuttle service from the hotel to downtown San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: If room reservation changes are allowed, I think that Expedia should make that boldly clear when using this third party service.

review.title: Very nice hotel,

Not so great are pool with no one monitoring the behavior of older kids

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
We only stayed one night but had a few issues that were ridiculous for the amount we paid.  The remote for the TV did not work I called down to front desk and they said they would send someone up.  After about 40 min. No one had showed up or called.    My husband decided to take it down to them.  He was told by the front desk that the department that fixed them (guess they need a special department for battery replacement) was gone and it would have to be taken care of tomorrow  (we had an early flight so that did us no good). Plus,  it just needed batteries I'm sure. 
Also,  there is a fire alarm in the bathroom and it would go off loudly whenever we took a shower.  My daughter took one and was scared to death.  They said the steam sets it off.  Safety is important to me but why would they put that kind of detector in a small bathroom.  It went off three times that night.  
The bedding on the foldaway bed was not new and the toilet bowl around the base was yucky.  The breakfast was great tho and beds were comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Check-in took a little time but went smoothly. Love the afternoon free unlimited drink, great way to meet with friends and chat. The cook to order breakfast buffet was very good. The suite is comfy and you can request toothbrush and shave cream if needed. Excellent service and fast internet!

review.title: I actually enjoyed it!
review.reviewText:
I was at the hotel for 2 days.   I had a little trouble with the functioning of the shower,  but I let the staff know and they solved the problem.

The room was very comfortable.  The sink needed some repair.  Water didn't go down very easily.
 Room # is 640;  a senior citizen room.

One staff member in particular was very kind:  The lady from the Philippines was very kind.   Her name is Love,  no really,  that's what I saw on her name tag!  When I asked her if she could hold our bags,  she didn't bat an eye.  Very pleasant!

The lounge seemed to be understaffed.  When she finally served us;  her service was good.  It just took longer than it should have.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast was good.  The only thing I would recommend is getting more help for the cook;  he was by himself on Sunday morning.
review.negativeRemarks: More help for the cook in the morning for breakfast;    Be more clear about the Wi-Fi.   You advertise that it's free;  it's not.
review.locationRemarks: There was a nice restaurant nearby, within walking distance.  Very convenient.

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent amenities.
review.reviewText: Excellent cooked breakfast and evening reception provided daily. Local amenities excellent, including very easy  airport access. South San Francisco less than a mile away; had lots of local facilities including plentiful supply of shops and restaurants to suit all wallets (El Camino Real is where vast majority sit, although Grand Avenue was beautiful).
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff.  Excellent service.
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi was very variable and kept dropping out depending on where you were (even within the same room).
review.locationRemarks: Excellent shops and eateries in South San Francisco (1-2 miles depending on where you want to go).

review.title: out of control
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but charging for parking and not controlling how people park. People park over two spots and when the staff was told that there was no more parking because of this, all she said was sorry about that and charged me for parking. No wonder why someone drove through their gate. With two parties at the hotel people had their children running around the upper floors playing games  with the elevators.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was nice
review.negativeRemarks: Since the parents can't control their children then the hotel should take a little more response ability and control the hotel for all the other guest

review.title: Caution: Airport Shuttle
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and is very convenient to the airport. However, be very careful of the hotel shuttle! Our shuttle was robbed when we stopped at the Hampton Inn to pick up other passengers going to the airport. Make sure to keep your carry on items in the bus with you. The passengers that put their carry on items in the rear of the bus were stolen. The whole incident took place in less than 5 minutes.

review.title: Hotel awesome

review.title: Roomy, Nice Extras, Parking Charge!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Embassy was typical to that at other Embassy properties. We had a large room that easily accommodated our party of 5. The hotel has many nice perks such as a hot, cooked to order breakfast, that really saves a lot of time and money. The evening reception of drinks and snacks is nice if you make it back to the hotel in time - they are generous with the drinks. So, overall, I do like the Embassy brand. This airport location hotel, however, was, IMO, a bit pricey, though I know its San Francisco and nothing is inexpensive there. But, what bothered me is that they charge for parking! Downtown, you expect that, but not at a more suburban location. It didn't seem like neighboring hotels were charging for parking, either. However, the morning cook staff were nice, the housekeeping were pleasant and responsive, so I am not complaining. I think if they ditched the parking fee I would give them a 5.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice amenities - full breakfast, evening reception, large rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking
review.locationRemarks: Over on Grand St there were many restaurants. Getting into downtown SF was not too bad after 9AM.

review.reviewText: Breakfast Buffett was great. They even included complimentary evening cocktails. Beds and pillows were comfy. They had all the amenities we needed. Their restaurant food was great. I enjoyed the quiet atmosphere.
Ok the shuttle service was slow.  It was cold outside but they had the AC ON.
review.positiveRemarks: Free cooked breakfast not just a few packages of stale rolls out ona counter.  Cooked to order eggs were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel and allow guest to choose air conditioning or heat not a centrally controlled system.
review.locationRemarks: Ok location easy access to the airport.

review.title: Never again!
review.reviewText:
I have always been of the impression that Embassy Suites is one of the best. Boy, was I wrong! While the staff were unquestionably courteous, helpful and efficient, and the complimentary food ok, the chesterfield (sofa bed?) was all spring and practically no mattress! It was the most uncomfortable night I've even had bar none. I've slept in jungles, rural areas in Third World countries, out in the open field on exploration and camping trips -- nothing beats this one. Three days after my stay I still feel the aches and pains all over my body!!!  I strongly suggest that an immediate evaluation of each room be initiated and applicable changes be made. 

One more thing: there is no justification for the $22 parking charge! Bragging about 'in and out privileges' is meaningless. It is obviously a 'cheap' attempt to nickel and dime your patrons. Please stop fooling around with this silly economics/accounting razzmatazz!
review.positiveRemarks: location, courtyard
review.negativeRemarks: Please read my 'experience'.

We stop here for one night to test and continue our vacation. It tiene out to be a very nice decision: Great rest, nice facilities, great breakfast. Quick check out.

review.title: Overall, it's a great stay!
review.reviewText: I read a lot about this hotel before we stayed, so I was well prepared. Just like many said, hotel is dated. The lobby area is pretty nice, but the room needs to be updated. Some of the furniture are very old, bathroom is ok, but needs updating as well. Some of the hotel staff are nice, but the front desk staff are not very friendly. The man that checked us in was not nice at all. He was short with us, not very friendly. I had to ask him questions about breakfast, Wi-Fi, and parking etc. Wi-Fi connectivity is not all that good like a lot of other people said. But they didn't charge us for it either. It works ok in the living room area, but hardly in the bedroom. The breakfast was nice, staff was great. The nightly reception was also great, the bartender lady was friendly. It was refreshing for us. Indoor pool was nice for kids, gym is satisfactory. So overall stay was great if you can get it for good price.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, indoor pool, free cocktails from 5:30pm to 7:30pm, free breakfast, The lobby court yard seating area, room layout,
review.negativeRemarks:
Free parking for guest, better Wi-Fi, renovate room and get new furniture, have a safe installed in each room,
more engaging and friendlier staff.

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText:
So we go to check in and get talked into paying a little more to get upgraded to their rooms on the 10th floor that come with free WiFi and access to free vending machines for drinks and snacks. Having 2 teens with us, we thought that was perfect. Well, the WiFi did not work and the vending machines were completely EMPTY! We called the front desk and we were told that they have had other complaints and were taking care of it. As of the next day when we checked out, still no WiFi and nothing in vending machines. 

At dinner, they were very understaffed and had 1 guy running around trying to get orders, drinks from the bar and serve. I thought the staff was friendly and really wanted to make sure we were satisfied but the management has some serious issues with knowing how to take care of their guests. So, B for the staff and a big fat F for the management.

BTW, this is the first time I ever leave feedback for anything, that is how disappointed I was.

review.title: Family Vacation to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I loved having a suite to stay in, loved the great breakfast, and enjoyed the free happy hour.
review.positiveRemarks: Great food and a very pretty hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: A shuttle from the hotel for New Years Eve to see the fireworks.
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do right by the hotel, tons to do in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel as always
review.reviewText:
We love staying at Embassy Suites. Kids always have so much fun. They have a very decent size heated pool. Great accomodation. 
My only cons are there are molds in our room and the coffee maker was not working.
Other than these we love this hotel.

review.title: Huge rooms, but...
review.reviewText:
The room was huge. The atrium is beautiful, the staff was very helpful, but the hotel smells old and musty, carpets are stained. The hotel needs to be updated.
Breakfast was good, but being that the hotel was packed for the holiday week, it could take a while to order omelet; finding a table was not easy, so this took away from the convenience of having breakfast at hotel to get out quick to sightseeing in San Fran.

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Excellent for families with 3 or 4 children.  Includes a pullout sofa/bed.  Great free breakfast which included bacon, sauasage, eggs and potatoes.  Also included bagels, toast, and drinks.  Convenient laundry machines.  Ample parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff were very friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport.  SF about 15 minutes away.

review.reviewText: Great breakfast!  Room accommodations were terrific!

review.title: Very nice hotel...
review.reviewText: Best hotel I've stayed in... My only gripe was there was no heat... My girlfriend were a bit chilly the first night, but we were given a lil space heater the next so that made a big difference...
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and spacious rooms. Very friendly staff. The hotel atrium is beautifully decorated. Free drinks in the lobby. Restaurant food was great too
review.negativeRemarks: They have air conditioning but no heat. They did give us a little space heater on the 2nd night of our stay though. That's what could be improved. 1
review.locationRemarks: Visit Pier 39 and Biscuits and Blues... Just do it!!!!

review.title: Staff doesn't care about guests
review.reviewText: The bay area was cold last week and the room was freezing.  I tried to turn up the temperature and the fan, nothing happened.  I complained to the front desk but was told that since it is central AC and the central heating was not turned on, it was useless to turn up the temperature in the room.  I asked if I could borrow a heater, was told the last two heaters were just taken.  Clearly, others felt the same and the staff knew.  Asked if they could turn on the heating, the staff said they would send me a blanket.  Waited and waited, no blanket was sent.

review.title: An overall nice experience in South San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The Embassy suites were an above average hotel overall. The made to order omelette were delicious.  Our heat didn't work in our room, but the staff brought us a space heater and it was fine. 

The only downside to our stay was a holiday party that was booked in the downstairs area. The parking lot was completely filled with cars taking up more than one parking space due to almost the entire lot being compact spaces. Most of the vans, trucks, and SUVs had taken a few spaces because the spaces were tiny. I think the hotel would benefit from additional parking, or doing some sort of valet service. 

I would stay in the hotel again, as holiday parties only happen once in a while. The staff were awesome, and I would recommend the hotel to a friend or family member if they were to stay in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were comfortable, and I loved the overall experience the hotel had. The Koi pond was nice, as were the live plants.
review.negativeRemarks: Additional parking would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco, and the airport.

review.title: A week in a suite
review.reviewText: First stay in Embassy Suite in years: pleasantly surprised
The rooms are a little be uncomfortable because you could hear everything thru the walls and ceiling and if you want to rest then that will be difficult.

review.title: Not kid friendly
review.reviewText: The vending machine didn't work, there was only 1 extra blanket and the furnace did not work, the wifi was atrocious and dropped every 2-3 minutes. 2 female staff in particular were very rude to us.

review.title: love the view close to airport
review.reviewText: it was a excellent stay i loved the comfort of the hotel . But i didnt liek was the fact that we had to pay parking , i found that really unappreciated because ,why do we have to pay were we staying at . I have stayed at the embassy's in milpitas and never had to pay for parking . But also the way they handle breakfast at this location was unpleasant.
Clean and comfortable. Great complimentary breakfast

review.title: Embassy Suites Always a Great Value
review.reviewText: Overall experience was satisfactory.  The only downside was an unpleasant encounter with a bartender in the lobby lounge.  The 7 Mile House Bar & Grill in nearby Brisbane is a fun place to visit.  Good food, friendly staff, and live music.
review.positiveRemarks: Embassy Suites are secure and clean.  The overall value is excellent.  Two-hour hosted cocktails in the evening and a full breakfast in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Bartender in the lobby lounge was not very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent, not far from the heart of San Francisco.  The 7-Mile House Bar & Grill in nearby Brisbane was the highlight of the trip.

review.reviewText: staffs are friendly. but facilities are old. the price is ok

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Beautiful grounds with green and opened spaces! Free breakfast is a perk!

review.title: No free WiFi and terrible pullout bed
review.reviewText: Very disappointed there was no free wifi. We stayed at Embassy Suites in Hawaii and had free wifi. Also the pullout sofa bed was absolutely terrible, not fit for an adult to sleep on. Everything else was great.

review.title: Nice hotel A/C didn't work.
review.reviewText: The location and staff at the Embassy Suites were good.  However; the hotel seemed to have no A/C that worked.  My room was cold from the outside air temp.  The hotel had to supply a noisy electric heater to provide any kind of comfort.  The free breakfast was barely adequate.  Medium to poor food, long lines and almost no where to sit.
review.positiveRemarks: Good bed, clean rooms, plenty of space.
review.negativeRemarks: Minimal extras in the bathroom.  Breakfast was hard work.  No A/C.
review.locationRemarks: It is only a couple of miles from San Francisco Airport (SFO).

review.title: Nice hotel, but doesn't justify the price
review.reviewText:
Overall a nice stay. The room was large, though it had a window to the roof of the lobby.
The main problem is the price vs. benefits. At these prices I got better rooms and service at the nearby Hyatt

review.title: Perfect for family..or a couple looking to escape!
review.reviewText: First of all just the enviornment and ambiance of any embassy suite is worth the stay!  Spacious room, includes a living area. Free amazing breakfast, free drinks/cocktails from 5:30-730pm. (Make sure you take advantage of all the amenities offered! You will definitely get your money's worth!) The only downfall which is not a big deal was the pillows for me they were extremely thick and hard but that is just a personal opinion.  Also in this area there is another embassy suites with bay views I would recommend you stay! It is a little nicer :)

review.title: birthday weekend for my daughter..
review.reviewText: we had a great time... just wanted to get away from San jose...this is the perfect place... next time we'll be sure to bring our swimsuits...

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: enjoyed my one night stay, very relaxing. Great breakfast.

review.title: Good location, dated hotel, ok price
review.reviewText: This is the first time I stayed at this hotel, the parking is expensive, at $22 per day, also no free Internet, at $13.95 per day. If you added this cost to the room, then it is not cheap, there are other better hotels next door. The hotel is crowded and busy, free breakfast is very good, also the free happy hour drinks. The decor is dated, furniture is old, my closet door cannot close, also the bathroom door is tight, water pressure is on the low side, carpet is stained and old, felt sticky. The location is just off the freeways, so getting to SF or SJ is easy, the staffs are good and polite, but shorthanded at the kitchen, just make sure you give yourself extra time for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Free breakfast, free happy hour drink, suite hotel, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Update everything, free parking, free Internet just like everyone else.
review.locationRemarks: Really not much within walking distance, there is a lot happening in SF, and it is only 20 minutes drive time without traffic.

review.title: Comfortable stay, but needs more time spent clean
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel, but sheets need to be cleaned more. Found blood stains on my sheets.

review.title: Dated, but clean hotel, great service, relaxing.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very well located for quick access to the freeway. I had meetings from Berkeley to Silicon Valley and this hotel put me in the middle of that route. The property is older, but they have kept it very nice, clean and well maintained. 

When you walk in the interior atrium will make you instantly relaxed.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was great, the woman at the made to order counter was exceptionally friendly. Love the interior of the lobby/atrium.
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi is horrible. HORRIBLE. It was barely usable. For being located in such a tech heavy area, the WiFi has to be better.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is a quick drive or mass transit away!

review.title: Noche hotel close to the city and the AirPort
review.reviewText: L very close to one cal train starion and ir has also transfer. The only thing that this transfer was always full

we had a great time... loved the Evelyn & Crabtree shampoo conditioner & lotion... full length mirror had to be my favorite though...
would DEFINATELY stay here again...

review.title: nice staff
review.reviewText: nice front desk staff.nice shuttle driver   .good breakfast
review.positiveRemarks: near the airport   . family oriented hotel
review.negativeRemarks: furnuture

review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and staff was helpful when referring entertainment.
review.positiveRemarks: Scenic lobby and breakfast were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle service drop-off and pick-up downtown San Francisco daily.

review.title: Nice hotel near the city of san francisco

review.positiveRemarks: Everything!

review.reviewText: If you book through a third party,  the staff will not be as friendly as if you booked directly through Hilton. The room and facilities were clean. Warning,  please watch your step when exiting the shuttle bus. The steps are a little steep.

review.title: Nice hotel

review.title: Good hotel

review.title: Standard Embassy experience-outrageous prices
review.reviewText: A standard Embassy experience with outrageous prices due to proximity to SFO. Room cleanliness was adequate, but not meticulous. I noticed several things that were missed. Room needed better maintenance- carpet was patched and worn and the shower rod was loose and sagging. Staff seemed less experienced and a bit complacent. At these rack rate prices, one should expect free internet and free parking, but there were charges for both. The free nachos and breakfast do not compensate for these very high fees.

review.negativeRemarks: include free internet and parking.
review.locationRemarks: catch an early flight

review.reviewText: This hotel is great, the room was huge with plenty of room for three adults on a business trip.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean and I enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub.
review.negativeRemarks: The outside of the floor-to-ceiling windows was too dirty.

review.title: Nice hotel!!!
review.reviewText:
Stayed with kids and parents...
Conveniently located and good shuttle amenities...
Strongly recommended ...

review.title: Not all that great
review.reviewText: I guess I was expecting more for what I paid for the room   parking fees. I have had much better stays at the Hampton Inn and for less & free parking. My room was nice, but not very clean (bits of food on the floor, black hair on the counter - not my color!). Breakfast may have been free, but it was a madhouse. First day there were no plates & when I asked the attendant where I could get a plate (for the buffet), she told me to go stand in line for the made-to-order breakfasts. However, the next day, there were plates at the buffet. Seems like she could have just said, "I'll get some plates." Almost every time I tried to enter or leave the parking lot (it required a room key card), the card reader did not work - I tried both my key cards. I usually had to buzz the front desk to get in or out (though they were always nice about it). It's also had to get to. You have to go past the hotel, turn left and then make a U-turn, then make a right turn to get back to the hotel. I wouldn't choose to stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: My room was spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the parking lot card readers. Clean the rooms more thoroughly.

review.title: Very nice hotel, relaxing friendly staff
review.reviewText: Walking distance to conference I was attending. Quick response following the earthquake with updates. Staff visible immediately following the earthquake checking the facility.

review.title: Nice Place .Convenient to San Francisco /SFO
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Embassy Suites due to its proximity to San Francisco attractions and the  airport .

We were fortunate to have free parking and free breakfast as part of our package .

The rooms were spacious and  comfortable .

Breakfast  was very busy but we always found a seat .The staff at the made to order breakfast bar were great .

Fisherman's Wharf was a 15 minute drive away .The airport is 5 minutes away .

There is very little to do in the immediate vicinity of the hotel . Be certain to have dinner before returning to the hotel for the evening .

I would stay here again .
review.positiveRemarks:
Proximity to downtown 
Proximity to airport 
Staff .
review.negativeRemarks: Seating for weekend breakfasts .Staff could be utilized to assist patrons in locating seating /tables .

review.title: Pleasure

review.positiveRemarks: love their service, rooms & free breakfast, I definitely will recommend embassy suites. thank you

review.positiveRemarks: The room was large and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV did not work in the front room but the bedroom TV did operate properly

review.title: Always a family favorite
review.reviewText: A little trouble checking in.  The person was trying to tell me he could not take cash for the room and use credit card for incidentals. The manager was too busy to talk to us but learned later he was incorrect. It was embarrassing.

review.title: Won't be staying there again.....
review.reviewText:
Had 3 adults and one child.  One adult and child tried to sleep on the sofa bed on a paper thin mattress.  Asked for some additional blankets and pillows and they were the worst quality I have ever seen.  For $350 a night it was a looser never to be repeated again.'

Hot water faucet had a leak that should have been fixed instead of running all over the wood cabinetry around it.

Breakfast was also a bust from the powdered eggs to the Danish that looked like it had been recovered from the bottom of the ocean  a week prior to serving it.  Not sure what kind of bacon they served but it was sure salty and rubbery.

They seem to charge for every thing.  Parking.....really, I'm staying in your crappy hotel.....
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms around us were quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: You shouldn't have to ask if you read my experience above.
review.locationRemarks: SSF a really industrial part of SSF that no one cares about after dark.....

review.reviewText: The hotel was big and comfy. The scenery has an awesome view
We're 5, and could stay with 2 doubles bed and one sofa bed. Kids enjoyed breakfast buffet and indoor pool. Clean, nice, and good price.

review.title: Visiting Bay Area & Coast
review.reviewText: The hotel was central to my visit. I spent the day in Princeton & Half Moon Bay enjoying the coastal calm. The evening brought me to the hotel in South San Francisco & a great dinner. My visit included a trip to a huge shopping mall in San Mateo & another in Palo Alto. I even fit in a dinner with a friend in San Jose. I'll will definitely stay at Embassy Suites San Francisco Airport again.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness & layout of my very inexpensive suite.
review.negativeRemarks: More directional signage at the breakfast buffet. I had to search for the bread & toaster and the juice counter.
review.locationRemarks: Already did.

review.title: Customer service
review.reviewText: The hotel and its service was excellent.  We enjoyed the daily breakfast.  However, we decided to leave a day early because my husband was not feeling well.  One  of your supervisors told Expedia  that we will be credited for a day.  When I called back Expedia the following day to make sure that I was credited (per the advice of Expedia)  and after verifying with Embassy Suites, I was told that Embassy Suites denied the one day was not refund.  I suggest for your integrity with your decisions.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff was very pleasant.  Daily breakfast was excellent.  Bed was very comfortable and room very clean. we enjoyed the Koi pond.
review.negativeRemarks: Integrity of your customer service; to uphold your decision/promise.

review.title: Close to the airport and freeways.
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to the airport and freeway but nothing else around. Breakfast was included which was a plus for a family of four.  Room accommodations were ok, bed linens were never changed even after three nights and repeated requests for another box of tissues were ignored. They deactivated our room key the night before we left and would not give us a paper receipt even though we did not have any charges (they said expedia would handle it).  I have booked through expedia numerous times so that was a puzzlement. Overall, not the best stay at a Hilton hotel; I have had much better experiences...

review.title: Nice Hotel, comfortable room
review.reviewText: good service, very nice complimentary breakfast and cocktails
review.positiveRemarks: room size, buffet breakfast
review.locationRemarks: good choice if you need to be near SFO

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay. recommend to anyone.

review.title: Hotel convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Have been pleased with quality, cleanliness of other Embassy Suites, but South SF Embassy Suites was disappointing.  Rug and upholstered furniture were old and dirty, half of the towels were worn and thin--bed linens worn--bed mattresses and pillows were good.  Dark room needs updating.  Breakfast to be avoided. Staff was pleasant, helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the city
review.reviewText: Everything flowed smoothly from the moment we stepped in to the moment we left.  What I thought would be a big deal when we checked out early turned out to be minor hiccup thanks to the friendly, patient, helpful nature of the staff.
review.positiveRemarks: how big it was, the bar, the ambience
review.locationRemarks: south san francisco, plenty to do nearby

review.title: Good hotel - little tweaks needed
review.reviewText:
Embassy Suites are a great chain for us as a family of 5. The two room suites and the inclusive breakfast serve us well. Overall this is a very good hotel. We had a couple of minor issues that we raised. Firstly our daughters (aged 16-18) were in the queen beds and my wife and I slept on the double fold down sofabed. The mattress on the fold down was basically shot and we could feel every spring. It was the most uncomfortable night I have EVER spent in a hotel. The staff gave us a mattress pad the next day which made it bearable, however it is clear that the mattress really needed replacing, and I didn't get the impression that the staff ever checked the fold downs. Secondly after a days sightseeing in San Fran we wanted a quiet swim in the pool. The hotel has a rule that it should be adults only in the pool after 10pm, however it is not policed, so at 10.10 I asked reception to intervene with the significant number of totally unsupervised young kids. By 10.20 I was still waiting so I ended up asking the kids to leave myself. Eventually a staff security member showed up at 10.25. It would be a simple thing to have a rota to check the 10pm cut off. 
If you are sightseeing in San Francisco it is not a convenient hotel. It is around 8 miles to Fisherman's Wharf, the local train station is not somewhere you want to be coming back to after dark, and taking the hotel courtesy bus to the airport and then a train takes over an hour.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall comfortable and great breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of sofabeds!

review.title: Recommend to anyone going to SFO for bus./pleasure
review.reviewText:
They are upgrading now so will be all 5's when they are done.  
Parking fee was the only drag.  
Free breakfast / bar snacks / 2 cocktails everyday of your stay.
Free shuttle to Pier on weekends

Was nervous about the location having not been there but after deciding to get a car it worked out great to be not tied to just fishermans wharf area. Also I would recommend getting a car to anyone, I read reveiw after review and they were against renting a car.  Parking downtown is bad but not as bad as they say.  First day paid max all day which we used. other days meters have 2 or 4 our limits but planned day accordingly and you can bring it down to under half.  Would of regretted this trip if we did not rent a car. Added some to the budget but would of been glad to pay after the fact of kids/wife telling me they are tired and want to go to hotel, or bored and want to go somewhere else.

One flaw was asking a person at the front desk what kind of food was on the menu and his reply was its all on the menu over there.  Would of prefered a reply like I am new and have not seen it but here is a copy.
review.positiveRemarks: felt like we were not out of the action, meaning the piers/fishermans wharf area. It is not as far as you might think for a vacation.would do it again
review.negativeRemarks: They are in the process of upgrading so from what they have done so far it looks like they are going to nail it.
review.locationRemarks: Not much in walking distance, but little town not far away. 5 minute drive. Also was great to go north to San Fransisco and south to San Mateo

review.title: An Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at this Embassy Suites Hotel because I love the chain.  We were taking relatives with kids to the SF Airport and wanted two days in SF.  The services were great and the free breakfast and receptions were more than you could have expected.  We utilized the shuttle to union square and airport shuttle and all were flawless.  We ate two days in the hotel restaurant and the food was very good.  The service is a little slow but it was well worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: Attentive staff and especially the reception even more than the free cook to order breakfast.  We love the 10 to midnight adults only swimming.
review.negativeRemarks: Seems difficult to transition from the reception to the hotel restaurant for staffing.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close and they will help you get there.

review.title: Close to AT&T

kept and our stay was a pleasant one.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to AT&T

review.reviewText: Family friendly, good breakfast, nice beds, but the hide-a-bed felt like springs with a sheet draped over them. I've stayed in other Embassy Suites which were nicer than this particular one. I'd recommend Embassy Suites in general, but not this one necessarily.

review.title: good hotel

review.title: Nice place but dated.

Both mornings the crows in the eucalyptus trees woke us up from 5AM - 6AM - the staff was accommodating but not much you can do about birds.  Every interaction with the staff was very polite and professional - definitely a quality staff.

review.title: room heating/cooling not working
review.reviewText:
The room was clean and the happy hour  in the evening with unlimited drinks was a great positive.
But disappointing part was the room heat was not working .

On asking they provided a mobile heater which heated only a small part of the room.

Also it was quite  rush in the morning as breakfast times were only till 9 am. On  vacation with long drives, it was quite a challenge to make it in time..
review.positiveRemarks: happy hour  in the evening with unlimited drinks

review.title: Hotel lobby beautiful! Breakfast great!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel lobby and breakfast, as well as the manager reception. Was disappointed in the room. Stayed at an Embassy Suite in Columbus Ohio and expected the same room quality. Beds were lumpy and uncomfortable. Carpet in seating area stained. Bathroom dated with ripply wallpaper and mold stained grout. Outside door did not close securely.
review.positiveRemarks: Manager's reception, breakfast, lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds need to be replaced; room needs to be updated.

review.title: Beautiful hotel but run amuk by children
review.reviewText: This is a very beautiful hotel but the weekend we were there it was like Pinocchio's Pleasure Island. Kids as loud as they can be and running around the hotel with no care in the world. Up and down the elevators, down the halls and some even screaming. Thankful the bedrooms face the outside and not the inside of the hotel. It was like the parents are staying here and doing there thing and saying to the kids do what ever you want but only inside these 4 walls. It was crazy. The next AM these same kids were running around the eating areas where there is a mediocre buffet (serve yourself). It was getting pretty gross when I see these kids touching the food but not taking it. We decided to take coffee to go and eat someplace else. The manager on duty stands around policing but not doing anything. Just watching. It was weird. Twilight movies weird. Again though it was a very pretty hotel and it could have possibilities if they had rules that parents need to follow if they bring their kids.
review.positiveRemarks: It's a good looking hotel. The Atrium and the Koa fish.
review.negativeRemarks: Have rules for kids. Adults should not have to pay to stay at a hotel and listen to kids play around all night long.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for travelers doing business near SF Airport or visiting SF. So much to do in SF and I cannot list it all.

Also as they serve breakfast down stairs the very bad smell of fried food is all over the place! Also you pay extra for internet which never works!! And ofcourse parking is extra! Overall our stay was OKAY!! Not worth the price we paid!!

review.title: Grandma, GrandPa and 4 grandkids
review.reviewText: Everything was a 4 1/2 rating staff , room ,pool but the fold out couch was uncomfortable for the 16 and 10 yr old girls. Beds were wonderful but a double bed was a little small to share for the two older girls. The room itself had two TV's which was great but the kids had way more fun at the pool. The breakfast egg choices were a little dry . Sausages were the best I have had anywhere. They ran out of fruit except for cantaloup by 10 when we finished a morning swim and were ready to eat. Better than average coffee.

review.negativeRemarks: Shower facilities in pool area. The brunch food. Eggs need to be moist. Fruit choices stawberries, grapes, pineapple, blueberries.

review.title: Nice, fair-priced hotel for families
review.reviewText:
For this trip, my four teenage daughters were along for the ride, so I hunted for a hotel that could accomodate six for a decent price. Staying in the heart of SF would've cost about $50 more, and it wouldn't have included continental breakfast. I had my car for this trip, so this hotel was perfect because we could stay out in the city until 9 or 10, then drive a few miles outside the center of SF to the hotel.

Now, if I were out with the adults, drinking, taking a taxi, etc...I would've stayed closer to the action. This hotel is near nothing except a freeway and some fast food places.
review.positiveRemarks: Great breakfast! This is a huge perk when you're feeding a big family! Big, pretty, safe hotel with a river full of fish inside the atrium. :)
review.negativeRemarks: Fire the snotty front desk person who charged me for parking despite my handicap placard. (They fixed it automatically the next day, though.)

review.title: Nice enough - probably won't stay @ Embassy again
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice enough. The breakfast offered is good. Haven't stayed in a hotel with "standard" sized beds in quite sometime - and will choose not to again. Reviews had indicated free wifi & parking - not the case. Internet access is $13.95/day. Chose not to pay it. Supposedly there was wireless access down in the lobby - wouldn't work. Checked with hotel staff - no idea. Used business kiosk, only 1 of the 3 systems was working the first night. Wanted to buy a bottle of water from the vending machine. Sold out of every floor our entire 3 day stay. I guess that's so they can sell more of their $5/bottle in the room. I would say this hotel is geared more towards business people who have expense accounts and don't mind paying for every thing and who like the managers open bar in the evenings.
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary full breakfast was very good. Interior atrium is nice. Rooms were clean & staff friendly. No problem with parking.

She also provided us with a map of Pier 39 and advice on when and where to go, which was very helpful as it was our first time. The suite that I had reserved was clean and had extra pillows for us when we checked in, I only had to ask for more towels since the two would not have been enough for all six of us. Great experience and I would return to that hotel in a heart beat!

review.title: Good Breakfast
review.reviewText: I stayed here over night with two girlfriends; the room had two double beds and a pull out couch. The beds were uncomfortable, the air conditioning did not work and maintenance couldn't repair. We didn't move rooms bc it just for one night, and we could open the window. If you are a light sleeper, this place is not for you. The walls and floors are paper thin. I did not sleep well with all the noise coming from the rooms above; it sounded like they were moving their furniture around?, and someone nearby was having a party or get together were ppl kept opening the window and talking loudly. My girlfriend who stayed on the couch (in the front of the room) said it was just as noisy over there. I would stay again only if my room was on the top floor and in the corner, away from the noise and it was for one nigh or two (at most) or if it was during the week since it may be quieter. The breakfast was good, they have an omelet station, hotcakes, fruit, oatmeal, juice, eggs, sausage, coffee. I guess the breakfast and complimentary shuttle to the airport made up for the sleepless night.

review.title: Phenomenal service! Highly recommend this hotel!

Our check-in was very fast, and they gave us our room keys within 5 minutes. We were also near a Costco, which was very useful! Overall, we would recommend this hotel to anyone, whether you're traveling alone or with a family!
