review.title: Family trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent experience overall. Nice hotel, good services, good staff. The complimentary shuttle to downtown San Francisco on Fridays & Saturdays is nice, they've done a good job at doing a schedule with departure & return times. However, once you're downtown your return to the hotel via the shuttle is not guarantied (believe it or not !). The trip to San Francisco is on a first come first serve basis with the driver controlling how many people are boarding, while the trip from San Francisco is more on a ''I'm big and impolite'' basis. For the return, the guests are told to meet at a specific address downtown which is fine in theory, the problem is when people line up (or pile up...) at this address, the first come first serve principle does not seem to exist anymore and some people will seriously show a different nature by pushing and cutting people off to get on the bus (I've seen it live before my eyes). The hotel should introduce a reservation system with confirmed return times putting the responsibility on the guests to plan their return accordingly: you have a time-stamped ticket = you board, you don't have a time-stamped ticket (or one with the wrong time) = you board only if there is room in the bus.
review.positiveRemarks: - Proximity to the South San Francisco CalTrain station, 5 minutes walk - Atrium atmosphere - Complementary breakfast & manager's evening cocktail
review.negativeRemarks: - Complimentary breakfast should stay open later - Not enough variation in the breakfast - Return on the complimentary shuttle from downtown SF
review.locationRemarks: - Not too many things to do or visit near the hotel. You need to get to Grand Ave (5-10 minutes walk) to find restaurants, bars, etc.

review.title: Good value if you don't mind driving into city
review.reviewText: Overall experience was very good. Convenient to the SFO airport, but a little bit of a trek to get into the city. The free daily breakfast buffet and happy hour were very good. The room was spacious (we were 2 adults/2 children) with comfy beds and pillows. However, The room was a little outdated. The rug and sofa&lounge chair looked a bit old and really need to be replaced. The bathroom was a bit old too. The staff was friendly, however, they didn't do a great job vacuuming. I saw the same crumbs on the rug for a week. Parking is much cheaper than if you stay at a downtown hotel. The free shuttle into downtown San Fran was good if you can get it, but the first-come-first-serve system was not good. Many guests wanted to take advantage of it and there was no order as to who came first. We were left out one of the days even though we were on the line before others. It's good if you have a car and don't plan to just visit downtown city. Oh yes, the elevators were annoyingly slow.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was very pretty. The free breakfast was very good. The free happy hour with snacks was a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need to be updated. They had SUPER slow elevators which were annoying.
review.locationRemarks: Not much near by other than the airport. There was a Wendy's, Denny's , Starbucks, and a gas station with a little grocery nearby.

review.title: Staff needs some help
review.reviewText:
On first day, the grettings was below expected as I was bothering them with our arrival. then our roon AC unit was not working and it took two trips from the service man to convince the front desk that it was broken. overall we had to sleep with our windows open on a very noise street. so far no rest. In the morning I was told that breakfast is closed at 10am. when I came down at 9:45am I was told to leave the premises of the restaurant and that it was closed and quote: " Go Away, We are closed". Second night was without incidents and skipped breakfast the next day.
on a second note, the Sofabed was terrible and could not be used but an adult.

review.title: Family Group
review.reviewText: We were traveling with kids, so the two room suite worked out great for us as did the complimentary breakfast. The hotel staff was very helpful in recommending and helping to make arrangements for six people to get around town efficiently. We used the laundry facilities while there; the area was clean though the dryer seemed slow for the price. The hotel was busy, but it was nice and quiet for sleeping. Check out was a breeze.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the open hallways, the see through elevators and the view.
review.negativeRemarks: One door to the pool area didn't work with our key, and there was a REALLY unpleasant smell in the gift shop.

review.title: Unfriendly Front Desk Staff
review.reviewText:
The front desk staff were the worst I have ever encountered at a hotel. They were unfriendly, pushy, and extremely unhelpful. It was very obvious to me that they were paid to push certain attractions and car services, this practice I find to be reprehensible. When I travel, I expect friendly service and honest answers to my questions. I have paid for service and do not want to be sold to the highest tourist attraction bidder.
I also found that asking the simplest of question seemed to cause them great stress. They were not able to give me an answer to any question and were wrong about several things when they did come up with an answer. I would rather have someone go ask a senior member of the staff, rather than give me a false answer just to get rid of me.
I will not recommend this hotel to anyone and I will never stay here again.

review.title: Family and kid friendly
review.reviewText:
The staff at the check in desk were more than accommodating .Their warmth and friendliness made us feel truly welcome. Housekeeping was prompt in responding to our request for extra linens and towels. The complimentary breakfast and the afternoon happy hour were a real treat.
The atrium decorated with trees and tropical plants and beautiful koi fish definitely put us in a vacation mode. The open air atmosphere was relaxing. My grandkids enjoyed the warm indoor pool (even though it is smaller) compared to their outdoor pool at home.
The hotel rooms were to our pleasant surprise quite big. The layout gave enough privacy and quiet times for the adults by a door that separated the bedroom from the anteroom where the sofa bed and another TV were.
review.positiveRemarks: The room size and the wood fixtures. Definitely the complimentary breakfast and happy hour !

review.title: Great for business trips
review.reviewText: I stayed here on a business trip and the suite was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. They had a great happy hour with complimentary drinks and in the morning they have complimentary breakfast. Perfect! Options for dining in the hotel were not great though and the menu was limited for dinner.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights over Memorial Day Weekend. Breakfast was extremely crowded with lines so long that we ate elsewhere except for the last morning of our stay. One day our room was never cleaned. We left that morning at 10am and returned at 7pm tired & exhausted after a full day of sight-seeing only to find that our room had never been touched. The "clean our room" sign was still hanging on the door. And, no, we had not forgotten to remove the "do-not disturb" on the door before leaving that morning. We called the front desk and they only offered to send up clean towels instead of immediately sending housekeeping up to our room. We had to ASK them to please clean our room. After an hour of waiting, it was finally done. Embassy Suites has always been good to us - we appreciate the suite layout which works great for families and their breakfast buffet is always great. However, next time we visit San Francisco we will not be staying at this particular Embassy Suites. They are in dire need of a management makeover.

This is one of the most poorly maintained, staffed and serviced hotels I've stayed in in nearly five decades of travel. First of all, the shuttle service is non-existent (at least the hotel offered to pay for a cab). Second, the hotel is dirty and shopworn. Third, it's noisy and poorly laid out with every room overlooking an atrium that includes a bar (well, that's conducive to a good night's sleep). The food served at breakfast is dreadful.

review.title: How a hotel should be...
review.reviewText: This hotel is the way a hotel should be! We checked in, following a day in San Francisco. The room type we were supposed to have was not ready, so we received an immediate upgrade at no additional cost. The staff was very friendly and we actually had two representatives who were assisting us with check in. The room was very spacious, clean, and quiet, as well as an easy commute to the city and to other areas we wanted to see, such as Milpitas. The following morning we had complimentary breakfast at the hotel, which ended up being a feast! We did not need lunch! Checking out was also a pleasant experience--no hassles whatsoever. The only negatives for me were the cost of parking ($22) and the fact that we were on the 8th floor (I do not like heights!) However, everything else was perfect and I will definitely be staying at this hotel again when we return to San Francisco to bring my son to college in September.

review.title: Tourist Trap!
review.reviewText:
This facility is actually pretty nice for an Embassy Suites, but it is full of hidden charges.
I had already checked in on line, but was asked for my credit card for incidentals - no big deal - but then the guy swipes my card as he casually explains there is an additional charge for parking. I finally had to ask how much - $20 for an unsecured, non gated parking area. The guy flippantly states "Well, it's San Francisco!"
The next morning, I decided to go get a soy latte because they have actual Starbucks at the bar! But the venti soy latte was $2 more than it costs at Starbucks. I forget what the actual charge was - something like $6.08. The guy who rung me up asked me 3 times if I wanted the change. He was absolutely determined to get that 92 cents from me.

Other than that, the facility itself is one of the nicer Embassy Suites I have seen. I try not to stay at them in general because the walls are too thin and they are typically older hotels. This one had great beds, but the walls were thin enough to hear the drunk guy next door.

review.negativeRemarks: the staff and the hidden charges

After visiting the city, we were even more satisfied with the location of this Embassy Suites. The location is away from the hustle and bustle and we felt safer away from all the interesting characters roaming the city streets. The complimentary managers reception and breakfast were also fabulous amenities! Would definitely stay here again!!

review.title: Normally one of the best for everyone...........
review.reviewText: The hotel was in good condition and comfortable as Embassy Suites are in general. The hinge on the bedroom door was broken but it was fixed as soon as we notified management. Two of the nights during our three night visit we experienced loud noises coming from above our room. Finally the second night after crazy fighting and abusive words, we called the front desk. It was 2AM and we were told security had already been called. Shortly thereafter the noise stopped but we couldn't really get comfortable and go back to sleep, as we had to get up early. The front desk said the people in the room were given "their last warning", and to notify them if we heard anything else. I think the people in (Room 407) should have been asked to leave, and possibly even the police called. We typically enjoy staying at the Embassy Suites, and have never had an experience like this, but do feel it could have been handled in a more professional way.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a superb experience at this hotel. The front desk staff was extremely helpful especially Arjay and Michael. They led us in the right direction to navigate the city; giving us maps and points of interest to explore. Two downsides to this trip had nothing to do with the hotel but with transportation and 49ers loss (or beatdown). We should've rented a car to come and go as we pleased. It was difficult to explore all the wonderful sights this city had to offer. Expedia gave us a chance to add a car to our itinerary, but we declined. The next time we will know better. Also, if the 49ers would have won it would have been the topping on the cake of a wonderful trip. We made up for the loss by hanging out in the beautiful lobby with many 49er fans(and Giants fans) during Happy Hour!!

review.title: value for money

I stayed at the Embassy suites, South San Fransisco during Openworld 2012. The hotel is very well maintained, and the rooms are spacious and clean. The level of service is very good and the staff at the reception will do their best to accommodate guests.

The hotel is just a few minutes from the airport, while at the same time less than 30 min away from Moscone centre by bus.

Internet connection is very good and available publicly.
I would definitely stay at the hotel during my next visit to San Fransisco

We happened to be extremely tired so we didn't bother to ask for another and we were only staying one night. The elevator noise was very annoying and the rumbling from them. The kids were going up and down them the next morning. Where the parents were, we never knew. Also we were up above, I think, the laundry facility because we heard the ventilation system all night and noticed the steam rising the next morning. We will not stay in this particular Embassy Suites by the SFO airport ever again. Maybe the one by the bay would be nicer?

review.title: My experience at Embassy Suites Airport South
review.reviewText: Overall I enjoyed my stay at Embassy Suites. The hotel is very nice and the breakfast buffet is wonderful. I was quite surprised by the outdated furniture in the room. You really should update the furniture. I was quite frustrated with the ice machine on the 5th floor. It never worked during my 7 day stay. I reported the ice machine issue to the woman at the front desk. She told me to go one floor up or one floor down to get ice and that she would notify maintenance to repair the ice machine. It was never repaired during my stay. I grew tired of having to go to another floor to get ice. The hotel manager (the man) was very nice, helpful, and accomodating.The man in the hotel restaurant named S. Eduardo is cold and unfriendly. I went to the rstaurant to place an order to go and S. Eduardo walked by me twice, never greeted me (the restaurant was not busy at all) he never spoke, never smiled. He basically ignored me. I should have walked away at that time. Finally, he coldly asked what I needed. I placed an order to go. He never said thank you. He is quite rude! I never went back to the restaurant again. He doesn't seem happy to be serving the public, Seems to be in the wrong job.
review.positiveRemarks: The wonderful breakfast and managers reception
review.negativeRemarks: broken ice machine and rude restaurant employee
review.locationRemarks: convenient to airport

review.title: Really unkind to strangers
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel on the last day of our tavel around California, because this is close to the airport. After my family checked-in, I returned the renta-car. I closely questioned about the shuttle bus service, but the staff on the front desk said 'It's quite easy.' It was really difficult for strangers to find a proper shuttle bus and I took the wrong one. There was another Emabassy Suites in Burmington! I had to go back to the hotel by the cab and lost much time to relax. The taxi driver told me that the shuttle bus service is confusing and he often took the customers to the hotel. It was indeed a horrible experience. The room might be OK, but it's hard to validate it because I just slept on the bed.
Another hotel where we stayed had much nicer staffs and shuttle services, so I wouldn't recommned this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Loved this hotel, family of 5 with teenage kids.
review.reviewText: We are a family of 5 (teenage kids), and this hotel was great! Having 2 rooms (living room has fold out couch) and 2 TVs in the room we stayed in was so nice. There were 3 sinks, a fridge and microwave. The hotel itself is beautiful, the lobby is filled with trees, and a large pond with koi fish. Free full breakfast was a huge plus, and free drinks during happy hour as well. The maintenance man came up to do a small repair (that we had not requested) while we were in the room, and gave us a coupon for a free movie rental and a bag of microwave popcorn for our inconvenience. I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: LOVED the beautiful atrium/lobby, and free breakfast. Loved that my kids had their own TV/room, w/out having to book another room.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was an extra fee, and too much in my opinion. We did not choose to pay for it, kids were bummed. Wifi should be included these days.
review.locationRemarks: Location was nice, very close to airport, and yet easy drive to the San Fran. There was a 7-11 in walking distance to pick up odds and ends.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Overall experience was outstanding. Great staff and the upkeep of the hotel was great. Not really a lot to see around the hotel due to it being more in an industrialized area near the airport. Rooms were also a little too cold, as you couldn't turn off the air conditioning in the room. But overall, great hotel. I would highly recommend.

review.title: Beautiful hotel w/ a great breakfast.
review.reviewText: This was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was excellent. The pool area was kept clean and the hotel overall was beautiful. My kids were sad to leave they like it so much. The location is less than desireable for a family vacation but, the highway system makes pretty easy work of getting to any attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Courtyard style, clean, nice pool, excellent breakfast, spacious rooms, and free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Due to it's location, it's constantly windy outside and there are no attractions within walking distance.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you have a car, bad if you are on foot.

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText: I loved the seperation of the bedroom from the seating area! The fountain, plants and trees in the middle of the room were beautiful!

review.title: Very nice hotel near airport, 40 min from downtown
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean, the courtyard was beautiful. The location is about a 40 minute drive from downtown San Francisco with traffic. The morning buffet breakfast was very nice, but very crowded. Pool area was very nice. Overall, it was a very nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: nice and clean, our 2 room suite was beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Buffet had good food, but was crowded.
review.locationRemarks: Location is near the airport, but about 40 minutes from downtown San Francisco with traffic.

review.title: wonderful stay.
review.reviewText: Very nice place. Loved the breakfast and free drinks in the evening. The front desk gave us a free movie voucher so that my husband and I can enjoy an evening without our daughter. The only drawback was the horrible toilet paper. You would think for the money we would have decent tp.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: Lousy toilet paper
review.locationRemarks: Quiet area

review.title: Great Hotel for anyone!!!!!
review.reviewText: Great Experience with this Embassy Hotel. Nice environment and setting. Employees were very polite, patient, friendly, and helpful. Breakfast was delicious!! I will miss it! Service was fast. Fri & Sat shuttle for free to pier 39. Maybe this service should be extended until Sunday. This service saved us big money. It was a little bit far from downtown, but I don't think you will get this service and accommodations in a downtown hotel for the price that I paid. Best of all it includes breakfast!! I highly recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Customer service and Breakfast was great!!
review.negativeRemarks: No shuttle to pier 39 on Sundays
review.locationRemarks: Great setting with plants.

review.title: A Family Place...
review.reviewText: THe hotel staff were very helpful and the rooms were clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast and evening drinks!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The pullout bed was BAD like Most other places...
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get in and out and REAL close to the airport but never heard the planes flying over

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to San Francisco airport
review.reviewText:
All members of staff were helpful and friendly. It's a very convenient place to stay before catching a flight (the hotel has a free shuttle service to San Francisco airport). Rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bed linens are luxurious and inviting.

The worst things: the complimentary drinks and breakfast service is poorly organized and something of a 'free for all'. Expect long queues at breakfast. It seems that there is inadequate staff on duty to cope with the 'breakfast to order' service. This aspect of the hotel service needs tweaking, for sure.

Charging for WIFI in this day and age is nothing short of gouging.
review.positiveRemarks: spaciousness, convenience for catching a flight
review.negativeRemarks: charging for WIFI.
review.locationRemarks: Just a couple of miles from SF airport, with free shuttle service to SFO.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Great and extremely friendly service, particularly at the bar where there were plenty of smiles to go around. Plenty of parking available, even on the weekends. Rooms were clean, although the sofa bed was showing signs of age and was a bit lumpy. Laundry facilities on site was a plus. A very reasonable commute to the city and conveniently located near the airport. Recommended for kids on account of the large rooms and hot breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Wait staff
review.negativeRemarks: Sofa Bed
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Best trip to San Francisco ever!!
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice. The room had everything we needed and more. The room was very clean. It is beautiful Hotel and we had a nice view from our balcony. It was the nicest hotel in which we have ever stayed.

review.title: Needs improvement
review.reviewText: room didn't have shampoo so phoned for more, never came so finally went to front desk to get it. rooms need updating. chaotic breakfast area. no baggage help or carts at check in. waited a loooooong time for shuttle at airport at night, saw other hotels 2 or 3 times before this one came around.
review.positiveRemarks: location and shuttle to airport. quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was lousy. you get what you pay for.
review.locationRemarks: good proximity to airport

review.title: Excellent Staff; Furnishings Need Improvement
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and attentive. My only complaint was the condition of the upholstered chair in the suite. It was really dirty looking and the seat sloped from back to front, making it uncomfortable to sit on and very unpleasant to look at. Otherwise, a very pleasant room.

review.title: What I liked and suggest for improvements
review.reviewText: I liked the staff, the free breakfast. I just felt the over all feel of the room and its amenities were kinda dated. They need to improve the bed a bit more, renew bathroom fixtures, include a safe in the room, and change the carpeting to something brighter maybe. Over all, the experience was great though...
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: paiod internet access, Old furnitures, carpeting and paid parking
review.locationRemarks: drop of and pck up svcs within 3mile radius makes it accesible

review.title: SFO hotel
review.reviewText: great airport hotel. would recommend. Great atmosphere

review.title: nice hotel, pricey parking rate
review.reviewText: we got a nice 2 room suite but the carpet felt like it wasnt cleaned or vacuumed. parking rate was pricey and should be included.
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast buffet, nice room and spa
review.negativeRemarks: carpet, expensve parking rate
review.locationRemarks: nice neighborhood, accessible, 10 minutes to downtown sfo

review.title: enjoy
review.reviewText: We had [leasant overnight, breakfast and a shuttle to the airport. Could not have been better

review.title: High highs and low lows
review.reviewText:
This hotel is well-situated to the airport and offers great perks like a great hot breakfast and generous social time from 5:30 - 7:30 pm. The atrium is beautifully kept and the poi are delightful. On the other hand, the pool and hot-tub area were less than pleasing (appeared dirty and foamy (to excess) but in fairness to the hotel... were filled to capacity frequently during our stay. Neighborhood offers little to see or do but complimentary shuttle to Pier 39 is a nice touch. Shuttle to airport also seemed very expedient.
Room offered "extras" like an easter basket and eggs under the bed, dirty carpet and a loud bathroom fan but the main double beds were comfortable. Our unlucky 5th guest spent two nights on the pull-out that was quite dreadful. Hotel offered extra bedding to soften the experience but an extra mattress would have been necessary to make the bed fit for sleeping. Hot water also took quite some time to reach the 6th floor (8-10 mins.) so taking a shower took longer than anticipated.
Really a mixed experience but would recommend hotel to others with some cautions.
review.positiveRemarks: Great complimentary breakfast, generous complimentary social gathering with yummy somosa and other beverages.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty hot-tub and pool area, dirty carpet in room and lack of hot water.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport in south San Francisco but isolated from anything worth seeing. Shuttle to Pier 39 a saving grace on weekends.

review.title: A satisfied customer trying to help.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is getting a little tired. Carpets could be shampooed or in some cases replaced.
Lacking a bit of reinvestment. Room service food was pricey compared to othere.The we got pizza half cooked. They did credit the cost however they let their compettion get one by the goalie!
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff helpful and prompt
review.negativeRemarks: Food from room srevice.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to airport however shuttle room for improvement.

review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Miss Deidra @ the front desk was amazing and assisted us with all of the questions we had!!! We appreciated her friendliness and courtesy to us and our children. She made them feel special by pointing out some of the very fun activities in San Francisco. Thank you!
review.positiveRemarks: Suite space with enough mirrors for the 4 princesses and the one king :)
review.negativeRemarks: The sofa bed was not confortable @ all and not updated :(
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to freeway, city and restaurants was awesome!!!

review.title: Too crowded and strange people
review.reviewText: The room was so cold, called front desk and they said they are in cold mode so we can not control the temperature!!! They had gusts in group of 20 people like gang group with the kids always making noise and all the times kids shouting or filling the pool without respect or giving the break to the other gusts. The management should give notice when they book for everyone. The strange adults of the group were drunk during happy hours and blocking the hallways and tables. Bad experience in spring break.
review.positiveRemarks: Atmosphere and green view
review.negativeRemarks: Too crowded and booking anyone including gangs, homeless, etc. because they have complimentary drink and the alcoholic people are out-there to drink.
review.locationRemarks: Not convenience, nothing outside but in-door.

review.title: NOISY!
review.reviewText: NOISY!! Overrun with multiple school groups. Staff wasn't much quieter. Food service was exceedingly slow.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText:
We had a great experience here.
The hotel was beautiful and very clean.
It was very kept up. The breakfast was very good!
I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.
I wish all my hotel visits were this good!
review.positiveRemarks: The service + clean environment!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Right off the freeway.

review.title: Dinner is no winner
review.reviewText: Dinner was not exceptional. Wait staff was not knowledgable of product or wine list. Needed more training.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: great location, close to airport, shuttle service very good.

review.title: Great with but a few exceptions...
review.reviewText: I have stayed here twice in the past five months 11/12/11 & 2/3/12. Both times for the weekend and for two nights, each time. The first time was for my birthday I was impressed with how quiet it is in the bedroom. It was clean and I have no complaints about the room. In fact all I can really day is that I arrived to my room with dinner and realized I didnt get any utensils I called the front desk who said theyd send some up. They never arrived. This most recent visit we brought out kids and couple of things came to light besides that the elevators were broken and generally not working well. The kids were very uncomfortable in the fold out couch. Te police were called to someones room and I had to speak to someone twice about removing a mistaken water bottle charge. But I had to call the front desk again to ask for 2 blankets and 2 towels. The blankets arrived about an hour later. It was 11:00pm how busy could they be? But then when she arrived she had the blankets but pillows instead of towels. Then she was annoyed with me about the mistake and the towels never arrived. But we enjoyed it and will be back. BTW The mangers special could be a lot better for what they are charging.

review.title: Cool stay after a long Day
review.reviewText:
Nice and Luxury
Not the newest decoration, but very nice.
Two Tv's near SFO Airport and Downtown.
Smart employees

review.title: Great hotel but...
review.reviewText: Overall great hotel with clean and spacious rooms. The down side was the fact that only two out of five elevators were working. Needless to say, with the cleaning crew using the elevators and people checking out or getting breakfast, it took around 10 min(or more) to get down to the lobby. Would have taken the stairs if it wasn't for our luggage and stroller. Also our room was on the 7 th floor and the only working ice machine was two floor down.
review.positiveRemarks: They have an indoor heated pool!

review.title: Not that good
review.reviewText:
Our stay was for 2 nights.
I like the staff and the breakfast was OK, but the room (319) was so noise because of the AC unit out side the room, also the window radiate heat in the morning, because it was not doubled.

review.title: we loved their free breakfast buffet
review.reviewText:
The hotel room is big enough and clean for all 6 of us. ( 2 adults, 4 children )
Free breakfast buffet was awsome...when we go back to visit San Francisco, we will stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: free breakfast buffet
review.negativeRemarks: internet service-the fee was like over 15 dollars per day...wow...I did not like it
review.locationRemarks: close enough to San Francisco down town

review.title: Broken Locks
review.reviewText: overall the hotel is beautiful the lobby and restauant are is wonderful and the roomsare very clean. the only down part was the sahefty lock was broken. this affected the way we slept because our 5 year old daughter was sleeping in the front room alone and we had to take turn s checkimg up om her to insure ourselves
review.positiveRemarks: lobby dining area
review.negativeRemarks: broken locks
review.locationRemarks: near airport

review.title: Winter party
review.reviewText: Very nice breakfast. Cordial staff? Nice size room
review.positiveRemarks: Nice size room and decor
review.negativeRemarks: A bit noisy once on main floor near cocktail hour/breakfast area
review.locationRemarks: Fine

review.title: Embassy Suites
review.reviewText: Breakfast was very good. Room was quiet, just the way I like it.
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: They had a plumbling problem the evening I arrived and they had to turned off the water for a few hours (11:00 PM)

review.title: Book it
review.reviewText: I love Embassy Suites. Anytime I go out of town, I search for an Embassy Suites. The friendly service, happy hour, breakfast and comfort. I feel safe and secure and all Embassy Suites have a cozy feeling to them. My teenagers also enjoy staying at Embassy Suites.
review.negativeRemarks: Waiting for elevators.

review.title: Embassy Suites South City
review.reviewText: Good location and very helpful staff. There is a free and frequent shuttle to the airport. The happy hour and very full breakfast are huge pluses. Down sides are a ridiculous charge of $18/night to park and the lack of free wifi. We got the former reduced to $9 and talked them into free wifi, so it worked out fine.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast and happy hour.
review.negativeRemarks: The fee to park and access the internet.
review.locationRemarks: The location is good, if you have a car. Buon Gusto, a great Italian restaurant on Grand Ave., is very close and not to be missed.

review.title: Would recommend, enjoyed our stay here!
review.reviewText: Beautifully decorated in lobby, very clean spacious rooms. Complimentary breakfast buffett with omelettes made to order. Close to airport, easy drive to downtown. Staff was very helpful and even printed directions to various recommended places.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, easy drive to downtown.

review.title: Just like home!
review.reviewText: I always enjoy Embassy Suites for the excellent quality of the hotel and staff. A wonderful time!

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Our stay at the hotel was satisfactory. I really appreciated the complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Really a beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff are very friendly and courteous. Beautiful entry, the view of the atrium from the walkway when leaving your room is gorgeous. The glass elevator is a plus. The complimentary breakfast is really good and they keep is constantly stocked and someone comes and cleans tables very quickly so ther is no waiting for a table. If you want to order your own breakfast, there is a chef waiting to take your order. It was a great experience. The only negative I have is that the rooms sleep 4-6 people and there were only two of us. My nephew was very impressed with the room and wants to go again.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: we had great stay at this hotel. very nice service. nice and quite. great breakfast. would stay again!

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: Our stay was great. The staff was very nice and willing to help out with anything we needed. We love Embassy Suites and would always recommend their hotels. Very satisfied customers

review.title: Bring a blanket!
review.reviewText: This Hotel does not turn on the heat until it reaches 48 degrees. I froze in my 56 degree room. The front desk suggested I use more blankets. I suggest you stay somewhere else.

review.title: Go niners!
review.reviewText: Best location and best quality for going to a Niner Game. Don't know what you will do when they move. Thanks!
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco. It has a great Italian Restaurant and of course North Beach in the City.

review.title: Breakfast was deeelish!!
review.reviewText: Our stay there was great. We enjoyed the delicious and filling breakfast. Wish that cocktail hour had appetizers other than gold fish crackers and pretzels, but the free cocktails were good. We were a little disappointed we couldn't purchase the Pacquiao v. Marquez fight in our room, but it wasn't a big deal 'cause we went elsewhere to watch it.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText: We really appreciated out stay at this hotel with our 5 year old and out toddler. It was comfortable and the free happy hour was fun for us!

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel and Breakfast.

review.title: loved it
review.reviewText: Great caring service. Cocktails hour was great and breakfast was delicious

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: The customer service was outstanding, the staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

review.title: Nice Amenities
review.reviewText: Nice to have the full breakfast, swimming, and free cocktail hour included in the price. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. A good choice if you need proximity to the airport.

review.title: I love Embassy Suites!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very professional and accommodating. The rooms were spacious and clean. The breakfast was excellent!

review.title: Excellent for aieport
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. Spacious, clean, convenient, Good hot breakfast buffet.

review.title: Nice accomodations but small details detracted from stay
review.reviewText:
Arriving everything was as we expected, but then several things became apparent as we were retiring, first the TV didn't work, a call to the desk brought a prompt response antenna disconnected, then the bed didn't feel right, another call brought another staffer to discover a fallen over bed pedestal. With three adults as detailed in our reservation sharing the room we needed another call for the necessary extra bedding for the sofa-bed.

The location was as close to the airport as possible which was great and with some more attention to detail for the staff I wouldn't have any problem recommending this hotel to anyone. All of the staff we encountered were very helpful, and overall the stay was good.

A minor note was another guest in the room next to ours left the TV on all night and together with a rattling coming from the air handling system annoyed my wife throughout the night, I to slept through it blissfully unaware. Next time we'll bring a "white noise" generator to block off the offending sounds

review.title: Excellent Customer Service
review.reviewText: excellent hotel experience

review.title: Magnificent California Vacation
review.reviewText: The service was outstanding, and the beautiful center garden with huge breakfast made an enjoyable vacation atmosphere.

review.title: Amazing Hotel.
review.reviewText: Truly made being away from home bearable. Felt like a vacation, office and home all in my own room.

review.title: very convenient for early morning flights
review.reviewText: great location for dfw travel. the "free parking" is a bit misleading as advertised however. i stayed at the hotel to fly out of dfw on a 6 am flight while away for four nights. i now know that the "free parking" only applies to the one night is stayed at the hotel. FYI for future reference.

review.title: "CLEAN ON THE OUTSIDE, DIRTY IN THE INSIDE"
review.reviewText:
We had a party of 6. When we arrived at the hotel, we thought this was a better hotel than the one in Anaheim. But apparently I was wrong.....

We had a lot of luggage's and NO ONE even offered to help us bring them to our room. Got to our room and within 30 minutes we got a NOISE COMPLAINT? Seriously? We weren't even making noises.... found out that the noise someone made was because of our footsteps. You can hear everything from the outside. This hotel wasn't properly insulated, which really sucked because we had a hard time sleeping. Our door lock was also broken, we did not feel safe at this hotel. We will never return to this hotel.

review.title: "The best complimentary breakfast ever"
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, clean, friendly staff very attractive attrium with big fish pond and all glass elevators. The breakfast was excellent! Western omlelets, bacon, eggs, pancakes etc. Happy hr for guests each day from 5-7p compliments of hotel. Room was large enough for my wife and I and 3 kids. I was in San Fran for baseball stadium tour. Drive to AT&T park was quick and easy and navigating in and around the city of San Fran was stress free for this stressed out NY'er!

review.title: "Great last stop for our vacation"
review.reviewText: The happy hour was a welcome treat for us at the end of our vacation, as well as the free breakfast the next morning!

review.title: Friendly Front Desk staff
review.reviewText: Deitra was amazing, she was friendly and very helpful, she should be in charge of the front desk

review.title: Far from San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very comfortable, but it hard to get into San Francisco. The hotel shuttle to the city only runs on the weekend, so in order to get in to the city you have to shuttle back to the airport and then take the train. The money you save on the hotel and free breakfast is spent on the train going back and forth and it is also time consuming. I would stay in the city and spend a few extra dollars next time.

review.title: okay for a late arrival into sfo
review.reviewText: I was traveling alone with my children on a red eye from Baltimore to San Francisco. I knew I would be too tired to drive very far due to late arrival (midnight). I was familiar with the hotel because I lived in Bay Area for years. My husband has also stayed at the hotel for business and he did warn that it was "kind of old". It worked for us for one night. However, it does seem to be in need of a makeover. One of the elevators had a very heavy smell of dust and the decor was quite dated. But, it was good enough for a 2:00 a.m. check in, a quick swim for the kids in the morning and then off to San Francisco to start our vacation.

review.title: embassy is the best
review.reviewText: I stayed there recently on a trip to san fransisco, my room was so comfortable ,breakfast was fab...no matter where I travel to I stay at embassy because its the best for me and my family

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. The room was great. The carpet was a little stained and so was one of the chairs. The rooms allowed some noise in from the outside and since it was kind of like a mall so it echoed alot. There was a bar downstairs and some guests were being quite loud but other than that the room was great. We booked with this hotel because it had an indoor pool and we wanted to take our 1 year old swimming. When we got there the pool was packed and the next day there were a lot of people in it too but it ended up working out. The breakfast was great. It was buffet style with some cook to order items. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

review.title: Embassy Suites - perfectly comfortable and accommodating
review.reviewText: Great Hotel!!! They provide a complimentary breakfast, evening reception, and morning newspaper. There's a gift shop and business center, though the computers are a bit slow. It's not convenient to downtown San Francisco without a car, but the hotel provides a free shuttle to the airport that runs a few times an hour during peak hours and you can pick up a BART train from there. That's how I got around. My room was a kingsize suite, microwave, fridge, dining area, and living room area. Great!!!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Typically Embassy Suites make us happy when we travel in family. This one is quite disappointing. We had a room on 2nd floor which should be non-smoking but it did smell a bit. The counter in the bathroom is very low, around my hip (I'm only 5'4) making it uncomfortable to use for more than a few minutes. The worst was the noise. The planes were still taking off till mid-night and it was quite noisy inside the room. There was no double panel windows and there were ventilation machines just outside of our window...

review.title: Mostly good, but far from perfect
review.reviewText: Front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was convenient to airport and downtown. Had everything we expected (suites, breakfast, atrium, etc) but the pool was closed for maintenance 2 days. Extra charges for wi-fi and parking were a big negative. VERY disappointed with 1 AM fire alarm when notified they'd be testing it the next afternoon!

review.title: mixed
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, spacious enough for a family of four. Unfortunately I wasn't able to enjoy since I broke my arm after a fall in our room's bathroom. Manager came right away and directed us to nearest ER. Hoping they can cover some of the medical expenses. The rest of the staff were very concerned and sypathetic. Gave me one night room service free. Location good, able to get to wharf and surrounding areas with ease.

review.title: Great hotel as usual
review.reviewText: The stay was as expected, great and comfortable. The rooms are spacious and clean as always.

review.title: will definitely go back...
review.reviewText: the hotel exceeded my expectations for the price i paid. my family really enjoyed their buffet breakfast and the happy hour. the location is really great for me because it's close to everything, just 5 mins away from the airport, 20-30 mins from the tourist spots of San Francisco, there is closeby malls as well. neighborhood is safe and quite. their rooms are spacious though bathroom is a bit small. the lady from reception was very helpful and friendly.will recommend this hotel.

review.title: pritty good placegood times
review.reviewText: good times

review.title: Very comfortable hotel for 5 or more!
review.reviewText:
For the first time ever, I accounted for all 3 of my children, usually when I reserve a hotel, I only mention 2 as listing 3 + 2 adults makes the hotel try to charge for an add'l room (no thanks!) or charge for a roll-away bed (stil no thank you!). The 2 room suite, 2 TV's & 3 sinks was awesome! Sure the bathroom was a little dated, but it was clean, just like home, lol!
There was a noticable "Party Policy" posted, which I thought odd until a group of teenagers asked specifically about Party Rules, this must an issue at this particular hotel? Embassy Suites proved vigilant as the rooms were quiet all night long.Then we went to the pool; I overheard the posted security turn away a mom with 6 kids, one adult per 5 children - she was over the limit!. Later when we got to the pool, it was total chaos! Obviously no one ensures the adults STAY. There was a group of 25+ kids & only 3 adults chaperoning them. These kids were obnoxious, loud & disobeyed pool rules. The guard came in a few times to shout warnings then the next thing I know the pool was shut down. The large group got out without complaint, getting kicked out was not new to them! A few parents like me who actually paid attn to their children tried very hard to reason with mgmt but we were punished with everyone else. This tainted our stay somewhat but I know it was an unusual situation (I hope). Overall I recommend this hotel for its comfort, we could have stayed in SF but the extra 20 min drive was worth it

review.title: Great amenities and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
Loved the hotel. What a great made to order breakfast and managers
Reception at night. Would recommend embassy suites at any time.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: we all were very comfortable and felt like we could stay for a lenthy time

review.title: Very nice =D
review.reviewText: Mucho perfecto

review.title: 49er Express
review.reviewText: Love this place. Everything about it is convenience and class.

review.title: Will Definitely Come Back!
review.reviewText: Our family loves Embassy Suites (my hubby, myself and our 3 kids ages: 13, 10, & 7) and this one did not disappoint! The hotel is nice and spacious, with lovely garden decor and koi pond in the middle. The suite are spacious and very clean (we had 3 sinks!) The beds were comfortable and homey. Our favorite is the included breakfast with the made-to-order omelettes and all the fixings. South San Francisco is close enough to Pier 39, North Beach, and downtown San Francisco to make it a great place to stay. Didn't enjoy having to pay for the parking, but I guess that's the norm in San Francisco...? The pool area was also clean and the staff in the hotel was extremely polite and helpful. Overall this ES did not disappoint. We just LOVED it!

review.title: California tourist
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be a very good value. Rooms were sizeable for a family of 5. We rented a car at the airport and easily found this hotel. Also driving into the city was easy on the weekend. Probaby the best breakfast buffet we have ever experienced. We eventually drove to the national parks on this trip. I would recommend to others traveling from east to west coast as a great take-off point. Only complaint was the sofa bed not very comfortable but they never are!

review.title: Great Transition Hotel
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 (two children under the age of 4) booked the Embassy Suites because we had 2 days between our time in downtown San Francisco and San Diego. We wanted something comfortable and quiet near the airport for more convenience. This hotel is fantastic for families with small children. Their atrium is beautiful and the children love the fish in the artificial pond. The buffet breakfast and hotel restaurant are fantastic and their managers reception is excellent. The pool is adequate as it was never a problem with feeling overcrowded. Great value!

review.title: So so
review.reviewText:
I expected a bit more for Embassy Suites and will probably try Burlingame next time. The security guys were rude to me and my daughters, pool was much smaller then I thought, and it took several minutes to get hot water going. The breakfast in the morning is too hectic and needs to be reorganized. They had things on the menu that were not available.

The front desk, housekeepers, and restaurant people were very nice and professional. The restaurant was good. Room was comfortable.

The hotel is a very short freeway drive to the city and you will save a lot of money staying here as opposed to inside the city. If you rent a car, you'll still save.

review.title: Embassy Suites in South San Francisco
review.reviewText:
It is a good hotel, they really have suites, not rooms, good size and the hot breakfast is really good. Janitors are not very well trained though, I did not like the fact the we had two flat screens and none of the remote controls did not have batteries.
Sorroundings are good and the airport (South San Francisco) is really close, so far away of the Golden Gate and Pier 39 though.

review.title: A Great Hotel Between SFO and the City
review.reviewText: I love the Embassy Suites concept: a huge atrium and huge rooms. Very comfortable property.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Room cleanliness and bathroom wasn't the quality expected: hairs found etc., ridiculous to pay addl' for parking, breakfast was excellent, free shuttle service to Pier 49 was a plus, indoor pool was great to use. No help from front desk on how to find BART transit system: computer sys wasn't working.

review.title: Watch the hidden parking fee
review.reviewText: They charge for parking. The hotel is in an industrial park, not the city. It is not valet parking, infact the parking is limited. But they charge you at checkin for parking. I have stayed at lots of Embassy suites, never been charged for parking before.

review.title: Business Traveler
review.reviewText: You have to pay for parking and Internet, but even after those costs are incurred, the overall cost was still less then the place I stayed last time across the street from this hotel. The breakfast is complimentary, and there are omelets made to order. I am a picky eater, and enjoy this service.

review.title: Embassy Suites Gateway - South San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I have never stayed at Embassy Suites before. I had to attend a Funeral in the Area. I bought the car and hotel from Expedia. The price was excellent. Upon arriving at SFO I went to Fox and got my car rental. I was supposed to have a full size. They gave me a free Full Size SUV upgrade! I drive one at home and that was fine with me. I drove to the hotel and checked in. The room was ready at 1:30 pM and that never happens when I travel. Usually your luggage gets held till the room is ready usually 4 pm at some hotels.

The front desk said there will be an additional $14.00 a day parking fee. I dont like that at all but many hotels are doing it now. I went to my room and it was on the 'Hilton Honors" for 9th floor. I opened the door and I thought there wasa mistake? This room had a sitting room couch, Flat Screen, chairs desk , lamps and a counter with sink and fridge below. Then there was a baedroom with two beds and a flat screen!! I never get nice rooms like that!! my Three night stay was very pleasant. Free full breakfast and free drinks and chips and salsa at night!! The day I check out I got the bill under the door and they gave me a bonus- NO CHARGE FOR PARKING!!!! Those people are wonderful. The food was outstanding in my room service orders. Hot delivered to my room!! they get 5 stars from me!!

Craig

Portland Oregon

review.title: Best South San Francisco Hotel Ever!!
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel, especially in the afternoon/early evening at the front desk was so very nice! Everyone was, but especially that shift. The hotel is beautiful, clean and a great place to bring children. They have a great indoor pool and hot tub, the gift shop is nice and the people that work in it are very nice and helpful. The rooms are very clean and well attended. The breakfast is top notch! What a wonderful spread, there is something for even the pickiest eater. It was a great home away from home and made us feel special.

review.title: Excelent
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean. Breakfast was very good

review.title: Not as nice as I would have liked
review.reviewText:
The website said that the hotel was renovated in 2007. The hotel room was a smokefree room that smelled like smoke, had numerous stains on the carpet and did not feel clean.

The main atrium was very nice and the breakfast was good.

review.title: Breakfast staff, cocktail hour make up for distance from city.
review.reviewText:
Embassy Suites is generally a safe bet in any market in my experience, but the breakfast staff at the San Francisco Embassy Suites were so awesome, they made this site a "must-return" priority for my family! The cooks and the buspeople went out of their way to be welcoming to our kids, and couldn't have been nicer!!! And front desk staff extended our checkout late enough that we were able to attend church in the city, which was much appreciated.

The hotel location was more remote than expected (near a business park, with nothing but a truck-stop within walking distance) but there was a shuttle to the airport, to catch BART into the city, and the indoor pool was a big hit with the kids. (Note: the hotel also provides a weekend shuttle into the city that we weren't told about, unfortunately, until after we'd rented a car the second day.)

The onsite restaurant was surprizingly good, and the prices were lower than San Francisco's downtown restaurants. The hotel staff even delivered free New Year's Eve party favors to each room-- a nice touch!

review.title: Practical hotel if you need to be close to Airport
review.reviewText: Embassy Suites is easily situated close to the airport. The breakfast is fabulous! Service was good. BUT, the room was shabby for the price. We would likely select an alternative for the next visit that required easy airport access.

review.title: Embassy Suites SFO
review.reviewText: good location-close to the SFO airport. only 15-20 min drive into SF (depending where you are going). comp breakfast a definite plus with made to order omelettes. room was clean. bathroom a bit outdated but still clean. bed very comfortable. would highly recommend.

review.title: Convenient location and great service for 49er games.
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suites, South San Francisco, is always the place we stay when attending a 49er Game. It is located five minutes from the stadium and the free breakfast and cocktail hours always make the stay a wonderful part of the sporting event.

review.title: I was like a tropical resort; very beautiful!
review.reviewText: Everything was amazing! The room was a suite, which we did not realize. I totaly get the name of the hotel now! Every room is a suite. Everything from the glass elevators to the atrium and Koi pond was impressive. We loved this hotel. The only thing that was a problem for us was the bathroom in the room. It was backing up and moldy. The curtain rod was coming off the wall so we were trying not to touch it too much. It caused the curtain to keep opening which made water splash outside of the tub. Other than that we had a very pleasant stay. The pool was clean and the pool area tidy. I give it an A-

review.title: Embassy suites: a good choice everywhere
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel in July. It was very comfortable. With a hot, delicious breakfast to start a day makes you full of energy. The hotel also had a shuttle service to the Fisherman's wharf which is very convenient. I also recommend the restaurant in the hotel. I have stayed in Embassy suites at various locations. It is always a good choice everywhere.

review.title: For the most part it was good.
review.reviewText: Problem areas: They charge $15.00 per night for parking in their lot!!!! For the $15.00 are we guaranteed security and safety for our cars? No! We were not aware of this. I made such a stink that they waived it. Extra couch (hide-a-bed) was so uncomfortable my son slept on the couch, not the bed. Breakfast was too crowded and not enough places to sit, so food got cold while waiting for seating. Otherwise, it was an attractive hotel.
review.userLocation: Phoenix, AZ (but am from the Bay Area.)

review.title: Nice....but
review.reviewText: Mixed reviews...parking fee was waived rather easily upon reviewing my Expedia paperwork. Upon arrival, the bathroom smelled like urine. The room looked kinda old, with frays noticeable on the chairs and sofa. The pullout bed was absolutely uncomfortable to sleep in (2 queen beds would've been better instead of 2 doubles). The room is just the right size for a family of 4 instead of a family of 6. The complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast buffet was more than ample.

review.title: Best value for five adults, by far
review.reviewText: Two queen beds in one room, a queen-size sofa bed in another room, and three sinks! Weekend rates were lower than anywhere else we could find in the San Francisco area, even searching 2-star hotels. Big comfortable rooms, and super breakfasts. Untouchable value in that area, and I'd gladly stay again.

review.title: Great Last Night Place to stay before flying out
review.reviewText: Free Snacks 5:30-7:30. Good breakfast. Free Shuttle to Airport. Large Suite. Great for last night in California before catching an AM flight. We (five of us) spent several days in Fisherman's Wharf, a week in Yosemite and stayed here the Saturday night before our flight out. Perfect!

review.title: The people working at the main desk were very nice......
review.reviewText: but their was one chef in the breakfast area that was very rude to the people he was working with and that made me feel bad for them. Although he didn't interact with the customers, which was fine with me. Everyone else was very nice , especially the little gift shop man. I really had a great time and would stay here again. Really the only problem I had was the cleaning people did not clean our room everyday and we have two kids so I found myself having to clean up. But other than that I would rate them a 3.5 star hotel.

review.title: San Francisco -- near airport
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with excellent amenities and a great breakfast

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel was situated around 10 minutes from downtown and 5 minutes from the airport and was easily excessible from the freeway. Our stay was comfortable and the amenities were nice. Enjoyed the full breakfast and the cocktails in the afternoon were great. I wish the parking fee was a little less ( $15 ) per night. We forgot one of our power cords in the room after we left and the hotel sent it across the country for free. That is great customer service! Would definately stay there again.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I spent one night in this hotel. The room was great!!! Nice and clean. Service was good. I will for sure go back to this Hotel...

review.title: Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: The room is a little on the older side, but it's huge with plenty of space. It's got its own living room area, everything is clean and nothing is so old that it is worn or with holes. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast buffet is awesome!

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel before and enjoyed it both times. It is close to the ballpark which we like. My only complaint is the hide-a-bed is NOT comfortable for someone to sleep on. We will stay again. Thanks :o)

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: breakfast not to well set up coupons to begin down each day a pain.

review.title: Wish we would have stayed longer.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was GREAT and the staff was EXTREMELY HELPFUL. Breakfast was better than any resterant we had been to on our trip. I would stay at the hotel as a vacation.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Couch that makes into a bed was very uncomfortable need to improve. Everything else was great

review.title: Not up to Embassy Suites standards!
review.reviewText: This is not your normal Embassy Suites... breakfast was a fiasco! Not enough help for the amount of people! Ran out of certain "made to order items"! The area was congested and there was not enough room for everyone!

review.title: hotel was acceptable for a 1 night stay, but i would try another airport hotel the next time around
review.reviewText: Hotel was near SFO airport and only less than 10 minutes away. But the room i was given appeared to be old. The room carpet was not thoroughly cleaned.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The only thing that i didn't like is that when the hotel charge us for parking. This should be complimentary. We have been to many hotels and this is the only time when we got charge and did not tell us when we were making the reservation. I think i should got a refund for this. If I have known from the very start i will look for another hotel.

review.title: This was a great way to start our vacation!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very accommodating to our family of five. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the staff was exceptionally friendly. When we asked directions to a store to buy a cell phone charger, the staff gave us one to use! The breakfast was very filling, and the lobby and atrium were very beautiful. My only complaint was that they charge for parking, but event then, when I complained about this, they waived it! Yay for Embassy Suites!

review.title: New year stay at embassy suites
review.reviewText: The stay was pleasant . The front desk staff were all very courteous and friendly.

review.title: Best Family Hotel
review.reviewText: Very reasonable price hotel and parking and good and healthy free breakfast. We are all happy, every body are friendly and helpful.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: it is a very pleasant stay with very helpful staff. the only inconvenience is that the hotel lacks a little coffee shop where you can grab a not overpriced hamburger etc...

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: At first glance, the hotel is impressive: vast atrium in the middle, rooms open onto balconies which surround this atrium, glass elevators, very flashy. The rooms look good since they have been newly renovated. As I discovered, these renovations were cosmetic not substantial. The room smelled like smoke to me. The entire floor was supposed to be smoke-free, but it seemed that staff had sprayed the air with some deodorizing spray and when that cleared the smoke smell was noticeable. The design of the hotel makes it an echo chamber for noise generated by patrons down in the restaurant and bar. There were people running up and down the hall and at one point I heard drumming, as if from big bongo-like drums, coming from a room nearby. The manager took care of this, but the problems kept coming. Some others: phone in the entry room didn't work properly, thin window in the bedroom allowed cold air and noise to penetrate, building set on A/C so I couldn't turn on heat in the room -- heat was set to go on when 53 outside, (they did bring me a space heater), door between living room and bedroom wouldn't shut, likewise cabinet door in front of the fridge, bed was mush, water temp in shower and sink fluctuated like crazy, quirky toilet, towels dingy, blankets thin, (they were generous with extras and I piled about three on top of me to keep warm), breakfast was terrible (though complementary), front door didn't close properly, and more. Management was courteous, friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great for family stay, convenient for air and public transportation
review.reviewText: Pleasant, professional staff, lovely hotel and room, generous full breakfast, great shuttle service (every 20 minutes). Would stay again when traveling to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel for family stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I did a lot of research for hotels and we decided this hotel would be the best for our family of 5. We read the reviews from other travelers and decided to try it out. We have to say we were impressed with the size of the room. The breakfast was also really good. This was a hotel well worth the price. The distance wasn't an issue for us because it only took 15 minutes to get anywhere from this hotel. We would definitely stay at an Embassy hotel in the future.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Clean, nice, big room, good breakfast. Would definately recommend.

review.title: Exactly what I expected.
review.reviewText: The room was perfect for my needs and exactly what I have come to expect from Embassy Suites. The location was a perfect balance between San Francisco proper and the airport and the homes of friends that we were visiting.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Very good value. Make sure you are aware that there is a $10 daily charge for parking.

review.title: will go again
review.reviewText: Good alternative to staying in the city. Price was reasonable.

review.title: A Re-Do
review.reviewText: The rooms were beautiful, clean and extremely comfortable. The graounds were clean and well maintained. The staff was exztremely helpful. One of the few hotels we will stay at again. Great breakfast, great price.

review.title: Amazingly Surprised
review.reviewText: My Wife and I were pleasantly surprised at the quality of our room, the very nice breakfast offered, and the happy hour drinks all for a fair and reasonable price for the SFO area. Our future travels we will always be considering Embassy Suites first. Our first few nights we stayed at a 5 star in downtown SF and while it was nice, the Embassy Suites rivaled it for 1/2 the price.

review.title: Nice room for two people but not four.
review.reviewText: If taking shuttle from airport. Be sure to have hotel adress. because there are Two Embassey hotels by Airport.

review.title: A No. 5 all the way!!!!
review.reviewText: Great!!!!!

review.title: We wil be back!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, & expect to be back soon.

review.title: It was a surprisingly nice room.
review.reviewText: I was expecting a simple room with twin beds. Instead, I got a suite with a living room with a television set and a bedroom with nice, ample storage and another tv. Both tvs were 35 inch LCDs. Very nice. I didn't have time to watch or get too comfortable, but it was a nice surprise.

review.title: Worth your money
review.reviewText: A very decent hotel at a good location. Very near to airport, 5-10 mins travel. They have courtesy VAN service to/from airport. Rooms are at good condition. Well maintained corridors and open spaces. I will say more than worth what you pay...

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was pretty good overall. We really enjoyed the made to order breakfasts-that was great. It was a nice clean atmosphere, but one day room service didn't take the trash out! Also, heat was not working properly for 2 days. But that was eventually fixed. Our biggest complaint was how loud the lobby gets on Friday and Saturday nights. It's a great disturbance when you're trying to sleep and you're room is on the 3rd floor. Maybe rooms are higher floors don't get as much noise. I wouldn't really mind staying there again if I had to.

review.title: good room space
review.reviewText: 2rooms, good

review.title: Avoid like the plague
review.reviewText: We had a terrible experience here. Service awful. Robbery ($5K) of valuables from our room. Wouldn't stay there again if they paid us to.

review.title: Very Pleasant!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and pleasant employees! The daily breakfast was fantastic and satisfying. Close to the airport and freeway, yet very quiet in our room. Room was large and comfortable for 2 adults and 3 teenagers. Overall we were impressed and so were our teenagers...which is a feat in itself!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. We needed a hotel close to the airport because we were arriving late. We stayed in a suite which was very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch.

review.title: Very Efficient Staff
review.reviewText: Staff great, full breakfast and "Happy Hour" nice touches. Our suite was large and well-equipped. Only complaint would be the carpet - it is not dirty, but very stained - takes away from the pleasantness of the rest of the room.

review.title: I'd stay there again in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: My first time at Embassy Suites. It was much more than I thought! Service was great and the room was very comfortable and spacious. Free hotel shuttle appreciated.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I've stayed at other Embassy Suites hotels around the country, and the service and standards at this hotel were less impressive. Service at the bar and at breakfast was questionable. We even decided to stay overnight at another hotel during our stay, as it was not at all enjoyable. With international visitors and choice of this hotel for location, would make me think twice again about Embassy Suites for this purpose. I felt with the service I'd received in other locations, that this would be great....I was sadly disappointed and so were my visitors.

review.title: Absolutely LOVED IT!!
review.reviewText: The rooms are spectacular and very comfortable. Service was great!! all the employees were extremely helpful. Full breakfast....very good! Business Center, we were able to print out our Boarding Passes the night before we left. You have everything you need and then some!

review.title: Room was nice...however,
review.reviewText: the room of the hotel was nice, with 2 beds + sofa bed, realistically u can fit up to 6+ ppl in there. the 2 tv setup was also good because tv may be watched without disturbing those who want to sleep early. however the downside would be not only is wireless internet not free, it is also very strange. it was very hard to connect to, and oh yah, apparently the printer was down as well so i couldnt print out some important document. the breakfast buffet was also unorganized...we walked in without being checked one day and the other day they checked the voucher but didnt take it away and told us that we could use the same one throughout our stays (then why did u give us 1 per person for each day then....). lots of kids running around in the hallway so can get a little loud at times. bed was a bit hard. tv reception was horrible in the bed room (major "snowing" effect). but other than that, it was an alright stay - close to everything around the SF area and the airport.

review.title: Great choice for the location
review.reviewText: Very roomy suites- Excellent breakfast options and managers reception. Enjoyed my stay even though I felt like I had no where else to go.

review.title: Buses?
review.reviewText: the complimentary breakfast was very good... the ambience was nice also...the only "bad" comment i have with this hotel is that they have to fix their shuttle buses, i guess it's the windows that were so "noisy" whenever we hit some bumps while riding on it.. aside from that, the experience was good...

review.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else.
review.reviewText: I've stayed in many different hotels/motels in San Francisco area. The best and most comfortable experience was at Embassy Suites. Rooms are elegantly furnished yet homey and comfortable, especially the beds. first time I woke up in a hotel back pain free. We did not want to leave. made for a very relaxing visit. indoor pool is great!

review.title: great hotel!!
review.reviewText: very comfortable, easy to get to down town

review.title: Great Hotel!!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Embassy Suites in South San Francisco was wonderful. All of the rooms are suites with a separate living area. The room was clean with lots of extra space. The staff was very helpful with any questions we had from directions to tips about the area. The full buffet breakfast had just about anything you could want for breakfast and saves money! The hotel is not right in the city, but is a short 15 min drive away.

review.title: Staff is great
review.reviewText: Spent New Years Eve in the hotel as my kids were flying in to SF that night. I was amazed at the attention the hotel staff gave to security and to make sure other guests could have a peaceful evening! There were New Years hats, etc. for the party, but we were still able to get a good night sleep.

review.title: Very umpleasant experience
review.reviewText: It you want warmth I would not stay here. The heat and air conditioning are both centrally controlled by the hotel; you cannot adjust your room temperature. Not a good thing!! The suites are roomy but cannot enjoy the stay due to frigid room temperature. It is not easy or fun to wrap Christmas presents with gloves and a coat on. The blankets are thin so ask for a few extra. The most uncomfortable night I have spent in any hotel, even colder than in Minnesota.

review.title: Family fun
review.reviewText: Great place, excellent complimentary breakfast. My only criticism is the grout in the bathroom needs freshening. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great Deal for the Money!!
review.reviewText: The Embassy Suites South Airport location was really quite roomy and peaceful. The complementry evening reception hour and made to order breakfast, really made the hotel the best value for your money when visiting San Francisco that is only 20-25 minutes from downtown. Other than not having a business center, they did give guest access to the internet by using the system in the gift shop. The most important part of my stay at the hotel was the customer service I received from the hotel staff. They were really helpful and very informative on information pertaining to things to do while visiting the Bay area. The front desk personnel also helped me to expedite the confirmation of return plane tickets back home. Hope all travelors that visit the San Francisco area try a stay at the Embassy Suites to experience the great stay I had while on vacation!!!!

review.title: excellent stay
review.reviewText: many amenities that I wasn't expecting. hot breakfast, happy hour munchies and drinks. beautiful scenery inside with koi fish. picked me up and dropped me off so i could sight see.

review.title: Would not return
review.reviewText: IT was TOOOOOO LOUD!! Too many parties and people being loud in the court yard. IT was ghetto. The doors to the room looked as if it was kicked in before. The humming sound from the electrical tours kept me up all night. The only thing we appreciated was the extra bed in the suite and closing door. Nice and private from each other. But I wouldn't stay there again. The free breakfast was nice! The bathtub didn't look clean!

review.title: Will go again.
review.reviewText: This Embassy Suites Hotel was of average size but very nicely kept. The room appeared to be newly reburbished. We ate dinner in the hotel that night as it was raining and found the food to be quite good. Very nice home away from home atmoshphere. We will go to this one again.

review.title: Convenient for business and pleasure
review.reviewText: I had stayed at the Embassy Suites before for business, so I was acquainted with the convenience of complimentary breakfast during the work week. I had no idea the Suites are so popular for family get-away weekends. There were a lot of kids having a great time in the pool. Perhaps a separate jacuzzi/pool area for adults could be offered.
